You wake up, today, not realizing that today would be any different from the day before. Events were usually monotonous in the Mallow Kingdom. This world you live in is filled with magic, monsters and crazy beings that don't exist in the, "Real," world, so to speak.

What are you going to do today?


First Story: You leave the confines of the city to make a delivery to another city, and get attacked by bandits and your cart is over turned. You discover one of the things you were transporting is a magical mirror that swaps the bodies of those who look into it.

Second Story: As a student of magic, you find a tome in a magic shop with strange spells. To your dismay, reciting the spell inside kills you- but your soul from your body, allowing you to choose a new host. The only way to exit a body is to use the spell, and the victim's original soul is eradicated.

Third Story: After you defeat a band of goblins, a cursed bracelet sticks to your wrist that transforms you into anyone or thing that you kill, from this point forward. It cannot be removed and you cannot shift at will, except by killing.

Fourth Story: A warlock steals your soul. Someone defeats him and undoes his evil, but your soul is returned to the wrong body.

11.content:
You look over your shoulder. Five men and black mustangs are closing in on your wagon, and they don't look friendly. You crack the reins, and tell your horses to speed up, but it's no use. The men on the horses move in front of you, halting you in your tracks, and surrounding you.

"What have we here, peasant? What's in the wagon."

"Food, Crops. I'm not a royal affiliate. I'm not carrying treasure or valuables."

The man laughs, and hops into the back of your wagon. "Good, Good. I appreciate an honest man. There's no need to lie and make this unpleasant for everyone involved." He searches through the contents of your cart, with a surprising level of integrity. While he performs a thorough check, he's very careful not to mess anything up or wreck the things he's not interested in. Except, "Found something," he shouts, bringing a brown package to the front, next to you. "What's this?" You look at the brown parcel, and admit that you are not sure what is inside. For some reason, you believe if you had told him it was nothing worthwhile, he would have believed you, but you don't test that theory.

"Deepest apologies, then. I'll be opening this." The bandit removes the packaging and removed an old looking mirror. It's not made of gold or silver or any valuable sort of material. There's no embroidery of gemstones, and there's even a number of scratches on the glass faces. It's a small, circular shaped mirror, with two reflective surfaces, one on each side. "It's worthless, he says, as he holds up the mirror and looks into it.

1132312.content:
Beating this body's wings as fast as they can go, you give chase to the pixie now assuming control of your life.

You're so small, or she's so big, that it's tough to keep up. Your carriage may be utterly destroyed, your horses scattered several hundred metres up the hillside, and the enchanted body-swapping mirror too heavy for you to carry (if it even works after the pixie dashed it to the ground). But you'll be damned if you let some mischievous pixie run off with your life!

You finally catch up to her, amazed at how big and frightening your old body looks from this angle.

"I won't let you get away!" You shriek in Selina's high-pitched, syrupy voice. "Even if it takes all day!"

Selina swipes her hand at you. You barely manage to flutter out of the way, feeling a gust of air send you sprawling. You brush green hair out of your eyes in time to evade another swat.

"What's a forest pixie like you going to do to me?" Selina taunts, laughing as you ping into her shoulder and chest. "I'm a strong man now. I am no longer limited to the wilderness; I can go wherever I desire!"

She grabs you by your wings and holds you up in front of her face. You struggle and thrash but it's useless.

"My magical powers... well, your powers now... only work within this forest." Selina explains. "Also, since I'm no longer a pixie, my language isn't constrained in rhyme anymore. I must say, it feels liberating to speak in free verse." Seeing your confused expression, her eyes glint with malice. "Go ahead, say something, pixie!"

You huff. "I'm a moth and you're the flame, if you think I'll play your game!" You slap a delicate hand over your mouth. Selina giggles, her louder and deeper voice rumbling like an earthquake over your head.

"How can you think this is funny?" You sigh exasperated, "Let's swap back, do you want money?"

"No, what you've given me is worth more than money!" Selina laughs again, flicking you into a nearby pile of leaves. You brush them off and lie on your bum on the forest floor, breathing heavily after this ordeal. Selina's body may be magical, but it's also really weak.

"You know nothing of my life! My job... my home... my son... my wife!"

"That is true, but I'm sure a villager up yonder will recognise me and guide me home. After the bandits attacked you earlier, all I need to do is feign amnesia. I'll say that they roughed me up so badly that I forgot who I was; your family will never suspect that we swapped due to a now-broken enchanted mirror, lost within the confines of this forest."

You realise that Selina could very well assume your life without anybody the wiser. In your many years as a courier, you've never transported any magical device that could swap bodies. Such a trinket was practically unheard of in the Mallow Kingdom; maybe in some faraway sultanate but certainly not here.

Selina places her hands on her hips. "Now I've grown tired of talking to you. Fare thee well, pixie! May our paths never cross again..." She waves before bounding up the hillside out of the forest.

"Please don't leave me stuck like this!" You call out to her, unsure whether she can still hear you. "A waif-like pixie in this abyss!"

You could chase after her, but after leaving this forest you'd be without her powers and unable to fly. So what's the point?

Still lying on the forest floor, you gaze upward at the midday sun before thinking of everything you've lost. If only you stayed in bed!

You wipe your eyes; a teardrop falls to the ground and a flower springs from the earth.

Regaining composure, you rise up and fly back to your overturned carriage. Most of these goods are perishable and will spoil out here in the forest; furthermore, the tools are much too large and heavy for you to handle.

Flying over to the cracked mirror, you inspect the damage Selina wrought to it. The glass isn't shattered, but it's badly cracked and you doubt you have the strength or wherewithal to fix it here in the middle of the forest. You try lifting the handle, but it's like lifting a tree trunk.

You're content to feebly drag and push the mirror up against a rock. Exhaling, you gaze closer at your new form.

The first thing you notice is your smooth, olive-green skin. The woman in the reflection matches your movements as she looks down her dress and gently cups the two mounds distending the top of the backless dress. You have breasts! They feel much softer than you expected.

You now have tattoos covering every inch of exposed skin on your arms, legs, and back. Most of them are inscriptions and symbols in a language you don't recognise, perhaps the pixie's mother tongue. You have several bracelets, rings, piercings, and studs all over, most of them adorned with precious stones that might fetch a lot at the local market, the merchant in you guesses.

The dark green dress clings tightly to your new form and bottoms out at the thighs. Below that, you're wearing a pair of black fishnet stockings and heels that look more sexy than useful.

You turn around to get a better view of the insectoid wings which meld into your upper back. It helps that the dress is backless, or else those wings would likely get tangled up. It also helps how tight the dress fits, constricting your chest and supporting your modestly heavy boobs.

Finally, you lean in and examine your new face. Selina's emerald eyes shine brightly back at you; pixies are well known for their devious personalities and it's shown in their eyes. As a courier, you were protected from interference by these tiny creatures by using potions, charms, and generally staying out of their way.

Your chin is slender and without any facial hair. You now have high cheekbones, a cute little button nose, and pouty lips that are a darker shade of green than the rest of your skin. You run a hand through your hair: thick, luscious waves of jade that smell like a fresh meadow.

There's no disputing how beautiful and enchanting Selina the Forest Pixie appears now.

You only wish you weren't her!

12.content:
As you flip through the pages in the dusty tome, the ancient characters seem to jump into your head. They're not written in any language you're familiar with, but as you look at them, something triggers in your brain that allows you to speak the words.

"Hey! Stop that!" the shopkeeper yells. "If you want to use the spells in that book, you have to pay for it! No freebies."

You pull out your wallet and take stock of your funds. You're on a tight budget. It's out of your price range for today. You attempt to return the book to its pedestal, but in much the same way the ancient words flowed through you, your hand has lost the ability to drop the book. You sigh, and instead empty your funds onto the counter.

---

The words on the pages flow from your mouth as you sit on the bench in the marketplace alley. Momentarily you wonder if you're making a mistake, but you can't resist the book's supposed power. You aren't even sure what this spell is designed to do, but your mouth won't stop reciting it.

Finally, you finish reading the spell. At first, nothing happens. You close the book and sigh, realizing you had been pla-

You drop dead without so much as a cough. People start screaming all around you and a white mage attempts to revive you to no avail. Looking down, you realize something is off. You've become a ghost. You float down to your body, but you can't get back inside. It's not as if it's just an empty shell, that spell actually killed you! You need to get back inside a living body. It's not your time yet!

Who do you possess?

121.content:
From above the crowd, you search for your teacher, Minerva. You'd be more comfortable borrowing the body of a friend than a stranger. If she could hear you, you're sure Minerva would want to help. You spot her, running towards the spot where your body gave out. You swoop down, and a force seems to suck you inside of her body.

You wake up, and once again feel air passing through a set of living lungs. The sun is setting. When you entered her body, you must have passed out for a few hours. There's no time to wonder, though, and run to the place where your body collapsed, only to find it completely deserted. No corpse, no crowd, no spellbook.

1211.content:
You return to the inn where you and your teacher were staying while in the city to rest for the night. This was a draining experience, but you weren't as worried as Minerva herself would be, were she in control. You needed to find a way back into your body. Surely, the spellbook would have a way of reversing this. Tomorrow you can track down both.

When you enter tavern, the innkeeper hands you two letters. You open the first one.

"Dear Minerva the Blue,

We regret to inform you that your companion was found, deceased, on market street this afternoon. Please come down to the morgue tomorrow at noon.

Deepest Apologies,

Jake Nilbog"

You release a sigh of relief. That takes care of your body, and with any luck, all of your belongings, too. With that weight lifted, you tear open the second letter.

"Minerva the Blue

Report back to the tower immediately. We're extremely disappointed that you allowed harm to befall your student while under your watch. Your punishment will be decided after you stand trial.

High Wizard Cage"

And that takes your breath away. If you didn't get back in your body somehow, not only would you be dead, Minerva would be in trouble for it. You returned to the room for the night.

You gently grasp them, but pull back and stand up, strolling over to the full body mirror in the corner of the room.

Minerva is pretty, you think to yourself as you examine her. Her long, blue hair looked and felt so soft and light. It felt great when it rubbed against her face, which was unscarred and young. She did seem rather young to be a teacher. Not much older than you. Could there be some magic at work keeping her young, or was she really just a prodigy?

Unlike the generic robes you wear, Minerva's are carefully decorated and custom made for her. She wears a blue cape, with a soft pink inner lining. The top piece of her robes, which is a separate piece from the skirt which comes to her knees, are especially loose, and made of a soft silk. Just wearing these robes felt like being wrapped in a super soft blanket. She also wore a pair of pink pantyhose that matched the underside of her cape. This part of the ensemble felt very odd, as they were a constant reminder that her no longer had any equipment down there.

Since you were lying down, you belly flop the hard concrete floor when you re-enter the real world. A stone floor, stone walls, a bed and bars. You've been transported to the school's holding cells.

One of the higher-rung teachers appears outside your cell with his arms crossed. "What part of immediately don't you understand, witch? So you allowed your student to be killed, and then you go rogue. If I didn't know better, I would think you killed him. What do you have to say for yourself?"

12513.content:
A strong force suddenly pulled you just as you hovered a little closer to the thief. You tried to flew away but found out you were unable to do so. In a split second, your ethereal body was sucked inside and you lost consciousness.


*****


It was just another fine day for Nadya. She got quite a lot of gold that day. Some came from flirting, some were directly taken without the owner knowing, more from a mix of both. For a thief of her caliber, nothing is too difficult as long as it involves drunk men in any taverns or inns.

Nadya travelled far from town to town, from inn to inn, from one drunk guy to another, preferably those with lots of gold. She only came back to the same inn after weeks to avoid detection, just in case things went bad. Well, nobody would suspect that a pretty, flirtatious young woman such as herself has the guts and skill to openly pickpocket people inside a crowded inn or tavern, anyway. Especially not drunk or horny (or a mix of both) males. Nadya was also quite skillfull with knifes, for self defense or lock-picking. Nadya never hurt anyone that did not provoke her, and she even ocassionally shared some coins to beggars.

Nadya was ready to steal another drunk man's coins from his pocket, just like any other day, not knowing that it will be the last day that a female thief named Nadya trully exist. Just as she extended her hand, she felt something invisible entered her body.

Nadya felt extremely cold that she could not move at all. Her extended hand, though, fell on her side, lifeless. She could not feel her legs and arms, and it spread to her chest. She stopped breathing, but she could feel her heart beat slowly. And then she lost all feeling from neck down.

All of this happened in less then 5 seconds, but to Nadya it felt almost like an eternity. For once in a very long time that she could not remember it, Nadya felt fear. If she could scream and cry, she would, but her body no longer obeyed her mind. She was only able to stare helplessly, waiting for the next horrible thing that would happen to her. She was hoping that all of this was just a bad dream, or at least an effect of a temporary paralysis poison or spell. But Nadya was aware that this was real, and she personally knew how paralysis felt and this was far worse than that.

Then she felt a ripping sensation inside her head, as if someone forcefully yanked out the content of her brain; her memories, thoughts, feelings, knowledges; the pain was unbearable. Nadya lost consciousness shortly after that, never waking up again.


*****


You woke up with a jolt while breathing heavily. You found yourself sitting on a bench, just beside a heavily drunk man. You immediately felt foreign sensation all over your body. Looking down, you see yourself dressed in a black dress, with a generous low cut top to show your breasts. Huh, that's new. Last time you remember, you were a male, and a male doesn't have gorgeous breasts like these. But now you have a pair.

Then the memory of reading a killer spell book which turned you into a ghost came back, and you also remembered that you seemed to enter a female thief's body, sucked in against your will, inside the inn. You put two and two together and concluded that you had possessed her.

At least now you had a body again, but a new problem arised. You didn't know who this thief was. Who knows, maybe she had a really high bounty that can make a single mistake resulting in you lost another body. And then a new set of memories struck your mind like a war hammer. Actually, that was an understatement. The sensation was so overwhelming that you screeched at the pain while clutching your head with both hands, and then fell down to the floor.

The sensation disapeared only after 10 seconds, but it had given you a life-time memories of Nadya, the real owner of the body you were inhabiting. No longer you felt foreign sensations or feeling uncomfortable in her body. Everything felt natural, as if you had been using that body all your life.

By the time people started noticing you who were kneeling on the floor, you already got back up on your feet. Looking at your hands, you shuddered. You as Nadya still remembered what she felt during the possession, especially at the last part. You felt somekind of identity crisis. You knew you were not Nadya, but you also felt angry toward yourself for taking Nadya's body... And her life. Somehow you knew that the real Nadya was dead, and you just had her memory.

You have two options now. Either found out whatever that spellbook was that caused all these mess and maybe reverse all that it had caused, or you could just live out Nadya's life; being a pretty young thief with a skill that you sure quite unmatched in this region.

"No, I'm not. I don't know how to say it, but I need your help Gladys." You tell Gladys as you come closer.

It's at this point that you need to convince Gladys of who you are. You then begin to tell her who you are. Gladys looks confused at you first and slowly more suspicious. You then begin to tell her things only you would know off. The question is, does she believe you?

"Look, I don't know what kind of stupid joke you are pulling together with him, but I don't want any of it right now. I am quite busy, you see?" Gladys began to say after you finished explaining.

"What? No, Gladys, this is not a joke! I am really in trouble here..." you started to feel desperate.

"I have hear enough, so if you please be so kind to get out of my room, I would be grateful. Where is that idiot, anyway? Is he waiting somewhere, laughing his ass off?"

Suddenly, there was a knock on the door.

"Ah, is that him?" Gladys said, quickly walked towards the door and opened it, expecting you. She was quite surprised when she saw the inn keeper standing there.

"Oh... What can I do for you, sir?"

"Excuse me, miss, but if I am not mistaken, you are here together with a boy about your age, aren't you?" The inn keeper said before beginning to describe your appearance.

You knew where this conversation was going and eager to hear the rest. Gladys, however, was rather confused. After she confirmed it, she asked why.

"Well miss, a townsfolk just came into the tavern a few minutes ago, asking whether anyone know the boy I just described to you. He was found dead in the plaza and now his body is at the church. I recognized the description and want to tell you, miss... Sorry for being the bearer of bad news..."

"I... See..." Gladys finally said after a moment of silence, "thank you very much for your trouble, kind sir"

"No problem, miss..." he said before nodding at her.

Before he left, the innkeeper looked at you. Well, more like looking at your breasts. You angrily clicked your tongue while muttering, "damn coinless pervert." Nadya's way of thinking 'you may be perverted or do perverse things to me only if you have lots of coins for me to take' came naturally to you without you realizing. You focused back to the problem at hand when Gladys slamed the door shut, though.

"Okay, unless you and that idiot also recruit the inn keeper into a sick joke of someone being dead, I guess I would have to believe your story," Gladys said, looking furious and annoyed.

"So you belived me now?" you asked hopefully.

"Not yet, I have to see 'your' dead body at the church. You'll have to go with me," she said, grabbing her robe on the couch and put it on.

"Gladly. I also want to see my body. Especially that book," you said, quickly following her out of the room.

After Gladys locked the door, you two started to walk downstairs to see your body at the church. Hopefully, all of your belongings, including the book, were also there with it.

125131131.content:
The short walk to the church was done in silence. It appeared that Gladys still didn't trust you, so she refrained from talking to you. The silence was appreciated though, as you need to think and prepare on whats about to come. Shortly after, the church was in front of you two, and Gladys entered without any hesitation. You followed suit. A priest was just finished tending a sickly man on the far right of the hall when he saw you.

"Welcome to our church, name is Luke. How can I help you?"

He was still young, probably only a few years older than you and Gladys. He wore a simple blue priest robe, possibly custom made since you never saw that design in other churches before. He was quite handsome with his messy short brown hair.

"Yes, we heard that someone was found dead and was brought here?" Gladys was the one who answered his question.

Luke's expression turned from kindness to gloom, "ah yes... So he is your friend? I am terribly sorry for what happened. I heard some healers tried to bring him back when he was suddenly fell at the plaza, but they were unable to do so, just like us"

"Wait, so it is really true?"

"Hmm? Oh yes, I know this must be difficult for you to accept... Your friend suddenly die like this..."

Luke missed the meaning of Gladys' question, but she paid no attention to him. Instead, Gladys stared at you with horrified look, combined with confusion and pity. It was actually quite painful for you to watch.

"Come, my father is trying to figure out his cause of death right now. One of the sisters here, Cecilia, is also helping him. We should see them at once"

Luke walked towards the back of the church with both of you following. You glanced at Gladys. It appeared that she was still shaken and was rather unable to accept the truth. You put a hand on her shoulder which made her jolt. She looked at you, and you looked back. She put on a sad face, but you returned it with a smile.

"Don't worry... I'll find a way to fix this," you said quietly.

Gladys sighed, and returned your smile albeit still with sad expression.

"No, we will... For sure..."

Luke entered a room where your old body was supposed to be. When he opened the door, though, he was in for a surprise.

"Father!"

You and Gladys followed him quickly. There, you saw your body on top of a stone altar or bed or whatever the priests here call it, but that wasn't all. An old man in priest get up was lying on the ground, which you assumed was Luke's father as he was kneeling beside him. Luke tried to shook him awake to no avail. Checking his breathing and his heart beat, Luke found that none was existant. Soon he realized that his father was dead.

"No father... What happened to you..." Luke was now groveling beside his dad.

A voice startled the three of you. You didn't realized that a girl was sitting on the floor, her back's on the wall, in one of the dark corners of the room. She stood up, and walked towards the three of you. She was about Luke's age, wearing a nun clothes. She was cute, if you may say so, but you were still prettier than her. Umm... You mean Lydia was prettier than her, yeah...

"Cecil, what happened? Why is my father like this?"

"U-umm..."

Cecilia or Cecil, like how Luke just called her, was fidgeting from nervousness and was unable to answer quickly, which tested Luke's patience.

"Please answer my question! Cecilia!"

"I-I am not Cecilia!"

"...What? What are you talking about?"

"Oh boy..." you thought, "don't tell me.."

"Luke... I am your father"
125131131.title: At the church

1251311311.content:
"Cecil, this is not the time for jest!"

"How could I?! I am dead, Luke! This is trully not the time!"

"But you are not making any sense!"

"Exactly! You are absolutely correct!"

"Umm..." you started to say.

""What?!"" the bickering father-son looked at you with intense glare.

"I-I think I know what is going on in here, at least partially..."

"Well, tell us!"

It was quite surprising to you that a pair of priest could be so emotional. They all usually able to stay calm in most bizzare situations. Nevertheless, you explained to them about your condition which seemed to calm them down a bit.

"I see... Yes, it all began when I pick up that book. I felt something that compelled me to read it... And the next thing I know, I was floating in the air, and accidentally hit Cecilia when she rushed to help my unconscious body," Cecilia, or rather, Luke's father, said after he listened to your story.

"You mean just like how we use commu-orbs?"

"Yes, but this is used without the orb, so it is direct telepathy... Ah, here it is..." Gladys seemed to find whatever she was looking for.

Commu-orbs (common way to spell "communication orb") were orbs that could enable people to converse from far away places. Low level ones had fixed destination, so they came in sets. High level ones need knowledge of mage craft to use, but the destination orb could be changed freely by the user. Gladys now attempted to do basically the same thing without the orb as the catalyst. Instead, using her notes, she started drawing a pentagram inside a circle on the floor using a chalk.

"I need your help... I won't be able to do it myself, this need a lot of mana, more than we apprentices usually had..." she said in the midst of drawing.

"Hey, look at me now... I am not a mage apprentice anymore, I am a thief... I don't think Lydia, who never practice magic before, has a lot of mana reserve..." you said helplessly.

"There is no choice, if we want this trouble cleared fast, this has to work..." Gladys finally done finishing the pentagram with specific runes for the spell, "besides mana, the person's belonging will help a lot. Go get something from teacher's room"

"But it is locked..."

"For god sake, will you ever stop complaining?! You said you are a thief now?!"

"Oh... Alright..."

Lydia seldom picking locks to rob people, but she practiced it a lot in case she got locked up. It took no time to open the door to their teacher's room. However, right before you entered, Lydia's instinct kicked in, and you felt danger ahead. You stopped and inspected the rim of the door and the floor inside. There was a "trigger rune" on the doorstep and a "trap rune" on the floor, possibly for a strong paralysis. Unless the trigger was deactivated, you wouldn't be able to enter without being paralyzed. Luckily, you have learned about this type of trap before so it was not very difficult for you to disable it. Stepping safely inside, you grabbed one of your teacher's robe and returned.

"Good... Now, try to channel your mana to me, I'll do the rest and hope we succeed..."

Talking with Gladys would be foolish now, so you kept quiet. Fortunately, seconds later, you felt a difference in the energy flow inside the circle. You knew it worked and felt relieved. Gladys kept quiet, but it seemed like she was communicating with your teacher.

Without your support, the flow of energy seemed to be disrupted and not long after that, the magic broke. Gladys was panting, clearly out of mana like you were. "...so, did you do it?" You asked finally.

"Good... Let's hope teacher returned soon..."

You never saw a naked woman before, let alone BE the naked woman. Touching yourself in various regions, you managed to elicit strange sensation from your body. It made you took a very long time for a bath, even by female standard.

Still inside the bathroom on the dressing side, drying yourself with a towel, you were startled by the sound of the door opening. Gladys was at the door, holding a set of clothes and a towel, seemed ready to take a bath too.

"You spent too much time in here..." she scoffed.

You smiled sheepishly. Gladys just glared at you, glanced on your chest, and glared even more. You realized it was the look of jealously, as Nadya's breasts were comparably a lot bigger than Gladys. You snickered.

"I know what you are thinking, Gladys," you said while grinning, purposefully lifting your left breast and let it fell.

Gladys turned red from anger and embarrassment, "Oh shut up, you perverted idiot! Hurry up and get out of here!"

"Okay, okay..."

You quickly put on Nadya's clothes and walked outside. You heard her grumbling angrily, but you paid her no mind. You then went to Nadya's room which she reserved at the inn before, and took her belongings. Then, locking the door, you walked to your and Gladys' room, laid Nadya's stuffs there, and went downstairs. The tavern was in its rush hour, full with people. Friendly chatters, people ordering food and drinks, drunken debates, all mixed into one. Noisy as hell. Nadya's instinct told you it was a perfect time for another pickpocket shenanigans, but you wouldn't listen to her instinct tonight. Instead, you walked toward the bar stool, and called the barkeeper, which was also the innkeeper.

"Here is my key. I got a new accomodation," you said to him.

Although you were happy that you finally got a room for yourself instead of sharing it with Gladys, she told you to return it and got back to this room with her. When you asked the reason, she said it was because you must not be left alone, as there might be someting that happen as you slept. You couldn't say no to that reasoning.

The innkeeper silently grabbed the key while eyeing your breast non stop. You remembered that this man did similar thing earlier that day. You were pissed, but decided to toy him.

"You seemed very interested in these..." you said while smiling coyly.

Startled, the inkeeper was stuttering, "oh, I uhh... I am sorry for my behaviour, miss"

"Oh, thats okay, I know most people can't resist them..." You said while walking away.

Walking back to your room, you opened up your satchel, took the magic tome, and laid it out on the table. Again, you felt the compulsive need to read it, but you resisted. Reading it once and dead was foolish, but reading it twice and dead again would make you the winner for the annual fool's award, if such thing existed. Instead, you inspected various books & scrolls from Gladys' collection, and lots of scribblings she made. Gladys was more of the research type magician, while you fancy battle spells more. It was also one of the reason you two were under the same teacher right now. You were supposed to learn from each other to cover up your respective bad points, but so far you couldn't keep up with Gladys' extensive research, as much as she couldn't keep up with you in combat training.

You picked up a book, supposedly telling you how to carve the best defensive runes based on the title. You tried to read several pages. Runes were one of the 'static' kind of magic. You put it someplace, and when it triggers something would happen, much like the trap in your teacher's room. Rune was not your thing as you thought it lacked 'action,' so you read it with disinterest. To Nadya's mind, it was even more gibberish. As smart as she was, Nadya had close to zero knowledge about magic, so it was understandable.

You were trying to read another book, this time about grimoire, when Gladys came inside. She looked at you and the book you were currently holding, then sighed.

"There is no mentioning of that tome in that book. Trust me, I read it twice when you took a bath"

You were touched by Gladys' effort to help you. You were glad you had her as a friend.

"...thank you very much, Gladys," you said, smiling.

Gladys raised an eyebrow, "for what?"

"For trying your best to help me"

"...there is no need to, I would gladly help you. I am sure you would too, if I am in your place, right?"

You just smiled at her. Gladys proceeded to sit on the bed for a while. She seemed to be thinking about something. You let her be and picked up another book about advanced defensive magic shield. This one piqued your interest and you were lost in reading that you almost didn't hear Gladys calling your name.

"Huh? Oh, did you say something?"

You saw that Gladys' face was red. You grimaced for a series of yells and name calling, like what she usually did to you as you made her angry, but it wasn't the case. Instead, she quietly talked to you.

"You know, seeing your dead body today made me thinking... What if one of us die for real? I know we being magician means we will always be close to death, but seeing your lifeless body like that really scared me..."

You were startled at her sudden confession. You always thought that Gladys was a brave girl, but it turned out she also had this side of her.

"Well... Honestly, I want to say that I will protect you, so that I will sound cool and all. But technically I am dead already, and so if I can't protect myself, I won't be able to protect you," you said with a bitter smile.

Gladys shook her head, "that's not true, you are more than capable to protect me. Your battling skill are so good you are almost on par with our teacher. What you lack is only experice and mana"

"*chuckle* Even if its true, that was my former self. If I can't go back to that body, then I am stuck with Nadya's body. Though her pickpocketing, thievery and seduction skills are unmatched, she was no fighter, let alone a magician... You could easily beat me right now, I am sorry but I can't be much help anymore"

"Don't apologize... Anyway, beside fear of dying, there is another thing that crossed my mind earlier"

"Oh? What is that?"

"That if one of us die, I will not have a chance to tell you my feelings... towards you"

"Wha-what are you saying?" You stuttered.

"Tell me, is it safe to assume that you like me more than a friend?"

You just nodded as if you were hypnotized.

"Well," Gladys's cheeks were as red as tomato right now, "I know this may sound weird, because now you are in a body of a girl but... I want to let you know that I also feel the same towards you"

You were dumbfounded at the sudden confession. It was obvious to Gladys that you loved her, as your method of showing interest were not the subtlest in the kingdom, but you still had not know whether she felt the same to you. The old you would have been jumping up and down and screaming from excitement, but you managed to just smile at her.

"Say something!" Gladys said, flustered.

Instead of obeying the order, you walked up towards her. She stood up in anticipation of what you would do to her, but she seemed surprised as you suddenly embraced her in a warm and tight hug.

"Thank you very much for telling me that, Gladys. You have no idea how happy I am right now"

Gladys just stayed silent before she returned the hug and started to sob a little.
125131131112.title: Night at the Inn

1251311311122.content:
You awoke to the sound of the door rattling. The key hole was being tampered by someone. Soon you heard the door lock clicking and the knob turning. The door slowly opened, and you felt another presence in the room.

Gladys was still sleeping. If you were your old self, you would be sleeping yourself, but now that you were in Nadya's body, things were different. Even small sounds might alert you now, thanks to Nadya's skill and exerience. However, you realized that this intruder had some skill in stealthy infiltratration, as he or she only made small noises even by Nadya's standard.

The room was dark as the oil lamps were not lit, but peeking through the darkness, you could see somebody's outline, creeping around. As it turned its back on you, rummaging through Gladys's book and scrolls, you silently pulled down your blanket, drew your knife and crept behind him. You then swiftly grabbed his / her mouth with your left hand and placed your knife on the throat with pressure just enough to break skin. The intruder was too surprised to react properly.

"Don't move if you still value your life," you whispered, "Gladys," you said.

There was no response.

"Gladys!"

"H-huh? What?" Gladys groggily woke up, scrambling to find her glasses.

"Turn on the lamps, we have a visitor"

Gladys used fire magic to turn on several oil lamps around the room quickly.

"Who are you?!" Gladys looked shocked as she saw a young boy, several years younger than her and you were, being held on blade point.

"This one here thinks he can just come in and steal our things. Well, not on my watch," you said, rather proudly.

"Mmmph..."

"I think he wants to talk"

You heard what Gladys said and moved your left hand toward his forehead, allowing him to speak but still restrained.

"*pant* *pant* N-nadya?"

You raised an eyebrow. He knew you, or more precisely Nadya, and you as Nadya recognized his voice. You reluctantly released him and for the first time you could see him directly.

"Rivo?!" You said shocked.

"You knew him?" Gladys inquired.

"Well yes, he is..." you said, but he cut you short.

"I-I am sorry Nadya, if I knew this is your room, I wouldn't come in here to steal," was what the boy said.

"I told you to always know your surroundings before you act. Breaking in is dangerous without knowing your target, you know that, right?" You found yourself automatically scolding him.

"Well yes, but last time I checked this room is supposed to be occupied by two magician apprentice, not you... Why are you here?" Rivo tried to defend himself.

"That's true..." you said to him, "but a lot has happened and... they are my friends now. And no, I meant real friends, not friend-before-I-took-their-gold friend"

"I... I'm sorry," Rivo said, bowing to you, before doing the same to Gladys.

"*sigh* Okay, fine... Come here and give me a hug..." you said to him.

Rivo literally rammed himself to you after you said that, before hugging you tightly.

"I miss you, big sis..." Rivo said softly.

You returned the hug and said, "I miss you too"


*****


"He's Nadya's brother. They were separated a few years earlier by an accident involving town guard. Nadya has been looking for him, but I guess she gave up recently..." you explained to Gladys after Rivo retreated back to his room, which you just paid for.

"Okay, what about that conversation you had with him earlier?"

"What do you mean?"

"You know, it seemed very natural... As if you are really his sister"

"I AM his sister... At least a part of me is... I forgot to tell you but, technically Nadya is dead now, and I am taking over her life..."

"...that's not something that you should have forget," Gladys staring daggers at you.

"I know, I am sorry... But I have Nadya's memories and emotions now, it just came naturally to love Rivo as if he is really my brother. And I don't have the guts to tell him I am not really his sister"

"But what then? If this is reversible, what would happen to Nadya and him? And what if it isn't? What are you going to do?"

You didn't answer and just starred on the floor. Gladys saw your hesitation and stop pursuing on the answer. Instead she extinguished the lamps and prepared to go back to sleep. You decided to follow suit.
1251311311122.title: That Night

12513113111221.content:
"I'll be right back, sis," Rivo said as he ran out of your room.

"Don't get yourself into trouble now"

"Where do you sent that boy? *yawn*" Gladys had just waken up.

"Downstairs, to get breakfast for us"

"Huh, it is a good thing to have a brother you can order around," Gladys said with a hint of mockery.

"Hey, don't say that..." you felt bad now.

"*chuckle* Anyway, do you think teacher is going to come back today?"

"I don't know, you tell me, you were the one who communicate with him yesterday"

"That's true, but that spell doesn't come with a pin-pointing location feature, you know. I didn't know where teacher was. And he didn't tell me directly"

"Then it might take days before he arrived..."

"Let's hope not... I was sure to tell him that we are in trouble, so he should take shortcuts, at least..."

Rivo came in with a tray-full of food. The three of you wasted no time to devour them. During the meal, Rivo asked you how were you doing since the two of you got separated. You had no trouble 'remembering' Nadya's life, so you told him all, until the part where YOU took over Nadya's life. You hadn't come up with a lie yet, so you avoided saying that, including on how you became friends with Gladys, saying it was a long story.

After you finished the meal, you took Rivo to town while Gladys stayed at the inn. It was Rivo's turn to talked about his experiences. You listened with feigned interest. It seems that during the time he was separated from Nadya, Rivo joined a thief guild (Nadya wasn't in a guild). There Rivo honed his thievery skill, aspiring to become as good as his sister. However, while Nadya prefers deception, seduction and pickpocket, Rivo broke into people's residence and directly mugging them before fleeing the scene.

Both of you ventured to the forest nearby and did some running. You played tag, a serious tag game to train them. Nadya and Rivo used to do this often. One person were given 10 seconds window to run away or hide from the other, and the one who gave a chase could do whatever necessary to catch his/her prey in 10 minutes. Rivo used to lose all the time.

You gave chase to Rivo. Rivo tried to ran away from you, but he wasn't fast enough to increase the distance. Despite this, you could see that Rivo improved a lot in a couple of years. Five minutes of running, and nobody gained an advantage yet. However, now you saw that Rivo's stamina was going to outlast yours. Nadya only occasionally exercise ever since they were separated, but it seemed Rivo did it rigorously. Your saw that your chance of winning was getting smaller each minute, until Rivo started to climb a big tree. You thought you had your chance, but Rivo climbed like a trained monkey. In 10 seconds, he was already between the top branches of the 10 meters tree.

Trying to control your breath, you looked up at Rivo, shouting, "you sure you joined a thief guild instead of a band of circus?"

You could sense that Rivo was grinning madly up there. You wouldn't let him win just yet, so you started to climb. All the while, Rivo was silently watching you between the leaves. Nearing him, you heard a rustle between the branches. You knew he was getting restless. You were on the branches now. Rivo was almost within your grasp.

Then suddenly, Rivo leaped down. He bent his legs, preparing for the hard impact, then immediately rolled forward once he landed. You half expected him to jump down. Rivo looked up, smiled, and continued his run. You groaned in frustration, then prepared to leap down yourself. However, as you readied yourself to jump down, the branch you were on broke. You fell prematurely, shrieking loudly as you fell. You fell loudly as you brought a branch with you. Rivo heard your scream and then the loud thud, so he ran back to where you were. He saw you laid motionless, sprawled on the ground next to a huge branch and its leaves.

"Sister!" Rivo screamed.

Concerned, he strode towards and quickly knelt beside you. You didn't respond, but as he wanted to shook your body, you caught his hand.

"Got you," you softly said while smiling.

"What?! Ugh, that's not fair! And not funny! I was seriously worried!"

"Hehe, I am sorry... But I guess I am not really okay, I think I broke my ankle or something..."

Rivo's anger returned to worry once more. He quickly inspected your leg and sure enough, your right ankle was swollen.

"Oh, this looks bad! Let's hurry up to the church to get you treated!"

"Why don't we go back to the inn? Gladys can help me there"

"The church is closer, I think... Anyway, let's get you out of here," Rivo said while trying to help you to stand.
12513113111221.title: Forrest Stroll

125131131112211.content:
You decided to comply to Rivo's suggestion and head towards the church. There should be some healers that you could ask for help. Though it was closer than the inn, the church was nowhere near you, so you would have to endure the pain in your leg. You tried your best to held back from complaining out loud and instead cursing inside.

"Hang on sis, we are almost there," Rivo encourage you.

Nearly half an hour later, both of you finally arrived at the church. Once inside, Rivo sat you down on a stone bench then quickly went to find someone to heal you. You closed your eyes, trying to suppress the pain. A minute later, you heard someone coming towards you. You opened your eyes and looked up, then surprised to see your teacher standing in front of you. Before you could say anything though, he knelt and started to mend your leg. A soothing feeling washed over your feet and you sighed in relief. Looking around, you saw that there were Rivo, Gladys, Luke and also Cecillia nearby.

"Is she going to be okay?" Rivo softly asked.

"She will be fine, this is just a scratch," you teacher plainly answered.

"Really?"

Your teacher glared at your remark, so you quickly shut your mouth.

"Rivo, we want to talk about something private, can you please leave us alone for now?" Gladys said to 'your brother'.

"Eh? But-"

"Rivo, please do as Gladys says. Don't worry, I'll be okay," you added.

Rivo hesitated, but finally he nodded and walked outside. Your teacher stood up. It wasn't fully healed, but your foot was only half as hurt now, as expected of your teacher.

"Thank y-"

You stopped mid sentence as you saw your teacher's face. You had made your teacher angry, it seemed. Cold sweat started to form on your body, you never liked it when your teacher was angry. You looked at Gladys and she gave you a pitied look. She was helpless to help you, for sure.

By the way, your teacher was...
125131131112211.title: At the Church

1251311311122111.content:
"Umm..." you awkwardly said.

"You, do you realize what you have done?"

You looked at Ar-Ravta, your teacher, nervously. His tall figure was always felt intimidating. He often beat you up when you screwed up, with his slim but well-built body.

"Err... No?"

You couldn't even stare back at his clean shaved face anymore and instead looked sideways. You braced yourself for the worst.

"You have found one of long lost artifacts which our school has been looking for since forever!"

"...wait, what?" you said confused.

You looked up again and saw that your teacher was grinning.

"This tome is tricky to find since if you are looking for it, it would hide itself. Nobody know how the book would reveal itself to people..."

"Soo... You are not mad at me?"

"Why should I? If you mean about your current predicament, you bring it to yourself and you took the consequences. I shouldn't be angry to you, that'd be unfair"

Your teacher's word sank your confidence even more. Him saying that meant this was not a light matter.

Despite all that, you mustered up courage to ask, "...is this reversible?"

"I don't know. Like I said, it is a long lost artifact. And there is no way I'm going to read it here, I'll get affected by its allure magic," your hopes already sank so low, but then your teacher continued even further, "also, even if it is reversible, your body will already be dead for too long that it will be impossible for you to use it"

"No..." you muttered softly, before asking loudly out of frustration, "then are you saying I should just accept my fate?! Taking over Nadya's life?!"

"I think so... That also applies to you, Father," Ravta said the last part at 'Cecilia', who looked almost as bad as you.

"Teacher, what do you suggest we do now?" Gladys suddenly asked.

"Well, it looks like your return to the academy will be premature. We need to look deeper into that tome, and surely your partner," Ravta said, glancing at you, " wouldn't be able to continue his magus training, so we should head back now. I'm sorry you have to be caught up in this ordeal, Gladys. I'll be sure to train you privately later for your final exam"

"That is fine. Thank you for your consideration, teacher"

Right, the final exam. Now that you had Nadya's body, you could say goodbye about being a magician. Sure, you could learn again, but that'd mean you had to learn from scratch. There was no way you could endure it all over again. When you were sulking, suddenly 'Cecilia' approached you and took your hand onto hers.

"Hang in there. I'll also do my best"

(S)he was the only person in the room who knew your feeling. You smiled at her.

"Thank you"


*****


"Sis, can I talk to you for a minute?"

You were already back to the inn. It was already past noon, and you were resting in your room when Rivo showed up at the door. Your teacher and Gladys were downstairs, having some lunch and leaving you by yourself.

"Sure, come in," you answered.

Rivo came in, closed the door and then looked at you who were sitting on the bed. He seemed eager to ask something.

"What is it?" you asked softly.

He hesitated, but ultimately asked, "are... Are you really my sister?"

His question made you froze. What did he mean? But then realization hit you.

"You were eavesdropping?!"

"...yes, now tell me what that conversation was about"
1251311311122111.title: Dark future ahead

choices: Rivo decided to take his sister back from you
Rivo decided to take your precious person as a revenge
12513113111221111.content:
"You mean... My sister is already..."

You fell silent after you decided to tell Rivo everything that had happened You think it would be best for him to know about his sister's well being. You knew it essentially admitting that you killed his sister, but if Rivo wanted to hate you or take revenge, then so be it. Death from his revenge didn't sound so bad, at least you could repent your sins.

Rivo suddenly took out his knife, you expected as much, then tackled you down. Losing balance, now you were lying down on the floor, starring at Rivo who were on top of you, raising the knife on his right hand high above. His face clearly showed his anger. You said nothing, just starring back at his eyes. Expecting the knife to fall down soon, you closed your eyes. But the pain never came.

"I can't kill you, not when you look like my sister"

You felt a prick on your neck. Rivo stabbed a needle coated with paralysis poison. You opened your eyes, but soon coldness overtook your senses and you couldn't move.

"I'll use that book to pay you back"

After saying that, Rivo stood up and walked out. You wanted to scream at him to stop, but you couldn't even groan out in protest. You started to panic. Killing you was okay, you were prepared, but Rivo using that book would produce even more trouble than it already caused. You tried to calm down and focus. The more you tried to fight paralysis, the more it bind you down. The poison spread throughout your body, and you tried to counter it by relaxing your muscles and nerves. Nadya had trained this, it would shorten the duration of paralysis by half. 5 minutes later, you could feel the effect slowly dissipated, and you carefully tried to stand up.

You first checked your teacher's room, but it was empty. You wobbly went downstairs, and immediately searched for Gladys and your teacher. You found them on a corner, eating on a table, and tried to approached them. In your haste, your focus wavered, the poison kicked back, and you crashed to the floor. Luckily your fall was loud enough for them to notice you. Ar-Ravta quickly came to your side and examined you. He figured out there were paralysis poison in your body, and casted a counter spell. You immediately felt better.

"What happened?" he asked you.

"Rivo... He... Took... That book," your mouth and throat still felt a little numb.

"What?!" your teacher bellowed.

"I saw him went out just a minute ago!" Gladys said.

"Gladys, stay here with her, him, whatever... I'll go after him"

"I understand, teacher"

Ar-Ravta bolted out of the inn while Gladys crouched down beside you.

"What happened?" she asked.

"He was... Eavesdropping on us... Then I told him the truth," you managed to say.

"Why?!" Gladys said, shocked.

"I... I don't want to lie to him anymore... I'm sorry"

Gladys just looked at you with a sad face. She helped you to sit up, then walked to the counter to get you some water. You silently prayed that your teacher could stop Rivo on time.

Then suddenly, you felt it. You didn't know how, but you felt it. Maybe because you were once in that condition, but it didn't matter. What mattered was you could feel Rivo's presence. He managed to use the book, and now he was here. You couldn't see him, but you knew he was here with you... And Gladys. You feared the outcome of this ordeal.
12513113111221111.title: He can't handle the truth

125131131112211112.content:
Whatever Rivo's intention might be, you must warn Gladys first.

"Gladys..." you croaked, trying to shout with all your might, but only short, hoarse voice came out, "run"

She didn't hear you. She still stood in front of the bar stool, waiting for the keeper to pour water to a glass. You tried to get up, your body still felt stiff, but you forced yourself. You started walking towards Gladys, hoping that Rivo felt hesitant enough not to try anything, so that you had time to warn Gladys. But then, it happened.

Gladys turned back, glass of water in hand, and was surprised seeing you standing up. A second after that, she froze. You knew what happened, Rivo had started to take over Gladys. At the same time, despair took over you. You desperately dragged yourself closer to her. The glass fell to the floor as Gladys' hand went limp, spilling its contents everywhere. You got in front Gladys, grabbed her shoulders and shook it lightly.

"Gladys, hang in there! Fight him!" you said, although you knew it was an impossible deed.


"..." you saw Gladys' lips moved, spelling your 'old' name, but no sound was produced.

Her legs gave out, and Gladys fell to her knees, dragging you with her. Her eyes was full of fears.

"Gladys," you hesitate, didn't know what to say, "I'm sorry... I love you, don't leave me"

Gladys' eyes softened, but then they were shut. Seconds later, it opened again, but it was not Gladys anymore, you realized. They blinked several times before starring straight at you, but they were not focus and showed the confusion that their owner experienced right now.

"Gladys?" you fearfully asked.

There was no answer and she looked down on herself instead. When she finally looked back at you and about to say something, she winced in pain and held her head with both hands. You knew what it was, you experienced it yourself. You lost hope for Gladys. Sadness and guilt overwhelmed you and, in turn, anger rose. Once the person in front of you stopped wincing in pain, with both of your hands still on the shoulder, you shook Rivo hard.

"You... Do you realize what you have done?!" you yelled right on Rivo's face.

"I..."

Rivo looked shocked and confused even more than before. He must be experiencing the identity crisis from suddenly having two sets of memories. But you didn't care. He just essentially killed Gladys. You knew you deserved this, but Gladys didn't have anything to do with your mistake.

But then Rivo started to cry. The guilt must have overcome him. Your anger subsided for two reasons. One was you realized that at this point, nothing can be done and you had to accept it. Second was, you never saw Gladys cried before. You knew it was Rivo, but it still soften your heart nevertheless. You released Rivo's shoulder and slumped on the floor, on the verge of tears yourself.

Meanwhile, the inn keeper was wondering what was the big deal of Gladys spilling the water to the floor.

"It's not like you were the one who's gonna mop it up," he thought.
125131131112211112.title: Third victim

1251311311122111121.content:
Not long after, your teacher returned with Rivo's dead body on his left shoulder and the tome on his right hand. You were sitting on the chair in front of the barstool, while Rivo's still sobbing on the floor. You glanced at Ar-Ravta with lukewarm eyes, and he figured out what had happened. Not saying anything, Ar-Ravta slowly laid Rivo's body on the floor and briskly walked upstairs. He seemed angry, but that could just be your imagination.

Nothing happened for minutes, before the innkeeper asked you, "are your friends okay? She's been crying nonstop and that boy hasn't waken up yet"

'He is dead, he won't wake up,' you almost blurted out, but you didn't find the energy to do so. As for the crying Rivo, you couldn't care less, at least not now.

Just then you sensed disturbance in the air caused by magic. It was quite strong that even you in Nadya, who wasn't proficient in magic could tell. The innkeeper froze mid glass-wiping and Rivo stopped sobbing as they felt it too. It vaguely coming from upstairs, no doubt Ar-Ravta was the cause. You could only wonder in fear what high level magic did he do. You didn't have to wait too long to find out as seconds later, three figures walked down the stairs. One was Ar-Ravta, but you didn't recognize the other two since they wore long black robe with hood that also covered their faces. But then you saw the symbol of the academy on their robes, so you knew they must be your teacher's acquaintances. Before you could even ask a question, your teacher commanded in monotone.

"Get up and stand near Rivo's body"

You knew your teacher was in a bad mood, and knowing your previous experience, it was in your best interest to do as you told immediately. Rivo, still shocked at the sudden intrusion of two strangers, just stayed on the floor, staring blankly at Ar-Ravta. Seeing the unresponsive former boy, Ar-Ravta grabbed his hand and forcefully yanked him up, then shoved him towards you. You caught him and held him still, as you somewhat knew what was coming. The three of them encircled you and started chanting. As you guessed before, it was a teleportation spell. Perhaps getting scared, Rivo tried to get away, but you grabbed him good. He's not going anywhere except to where this teleportation spell would take all of you. A moment later, the spell completed and a blinding flash erupted from the magic circle below your feet. In an instant, you, Rivo, his dead body, Ar-Ravta and the other two people disappeared from the inn.

As he opened his eyes, the innkeeper saw that nobody was there, and he was left alone. He was dumbfounded for a few moments before finally realized something and shouted in anger.

"They run away without paying for their meals!!"
1251311311122111121.title: Going on a Trip

12513113111221111211.content:
A blinding light signaled the end of the trip. When you opened your eyes, you found your self of where it all started. The legendary castle that floated in the sky, vast and massive like an ocean. It blocked the entire sun from it was placed, it's ginormous shadow covering the small city below. Your teacher, having recovered from the trip easily, was walking with the two hooded people towards the entrance of the castle. You pushed Rivo along the road, leading him to trip on the floor and being slightly scratched. You're still furious of what happened in the inn.

"Oww..." He whimpered with the voice of the one you loved as he hit the platinum floors

"You don't know what you have done." You snarl, causing him to flinch. He tries to bite back a reply but in turn can't reply at all. You grab his arm and dragged him quickly towards your teacher. When you catch up, you find Ravta and the two hooded men preparing a ritual in the entrance hall. The ritual consisted of many mana stones and diamonds that it would make an entire city rich again. You are curious on the fact and your body instinctively tried to reach for a diamond but you were slapped away by your teacher.

"You cannot take any of these materials. They are vital to bring back Gladys." Ravta says, sternly.
"You can bring back Gladys?" You gasp, now filled with hope.
"Just watch." He replies, not in the mood to talk.

The men looked like they completed the preparations. Rivo was forcefully laid onto the middle of the ritual, laying nearby his original body. The diamonds formed a complete pentagram around the two bodies, surrounding them. The two men began to chant.

"Heorm tokaro no frea." The two chanted in unison.
"Heorm tokaro no frea." The two repeated in unison
As they continuously repeated their chant, the diamonds that surrounded Rivo and body started glowing, their light shine brilliantly. Each chant made the light grow stronger and stronger. Finally, after the tenth chant, the light receded from the diamonds and were absorbed into Rivo and his body. Both bodies suddenly convulsed and sporadically moved fast. The bodies stopped moving after what seemed like an hour, but in reality was only 5 minutes. During that time, no one spoke. Suddenly, a darkness rose from the body of Rivo and Gladys. The darkness formed a huge monstrosity, for what seemed like a fusion between a dragon, human, and tiger. It opened its mouth, bellowing a earth shattering roar that rebounded throughout the walls of the castle.

"That is just a piece of what resides in that artifact." One of the hooded men says.

125131131112211112111.content:
The dragons pressure immediately made you feel a new feeling that you haven't felt in a while. You felt terrified, and couldn't even move.
The two hooded wizards immediately started to cast a spell, perfectly in unison. The dragon didn't like their motion, sensing that was signaled an omen that would either get it killed or severely injured. It quickly rushed towards the hooded wizards but were suddenly rebounded by a blast of ice.

"Not so fast fella. You aren't going to go near them." Ravta said while grinning.

The dragon snarls, and suddenly it's ruby red eyes gleamed. It quickly made a plan that will make it the victor. It's body convulsed, and wings came out from its back. The wings rapidly flapped, producing a extremely strong wind that knocked back everyone, including the ritual materials.

The Wizards stopped chanting their original spell and quickly changed to a new one.

"Haoro no Threa." Both of the wizards chant.

Suddenly, everything that was blown were stopped in motion, floating in the air. Everyone were set gently to the ground. The dragon was surprised. It opened its mouth, and started laughing.

"You actually think you can stand a chance against me? The Great Ouroboron?" The dragon laughed scornfully, seemingly not caring that his initial plan was foiled. He started to rest on the castle floor, now bored of the wizards.

"Just leave now and I think I can keep a couple of you alive." The dragon said, amusingly
One of the hooded wizards started to quiver in anger from the dragon's response.
"You're so overconfident that you think you can 'keep' us? We could destroy you in a instant right now." The wizard said. You didn't realize this before, but the voice was more female.

The dragon started laughing loudly now, it's chuckle resounding throughout the castle.

"The thing is, you've already lost." The dragon said, now having fun.

"The pieces will come back together now that I am free. The world will be devoured by the darkness that you have unleashed. I don't need to win this battle to win the war." It explained.

"You are nothing but a piece of a curse on a artifact. You're nothing!" The woman wizard yelled, and started preparing a spell, alone. The other hooded wizard stopped the woman though, pointed towards the dragon. The dragon was visibly disappearing into dust right in front of your eyes.

"Don't worry. I'll come back. This is just the beginning of a fun trip you guys will be going on." The dragon laughed as it disappeared into the world.

You finally regained your normal behavior, sighing to relieve yourself from the experience.

"Teacher, I think you need to explain what just happened." You say.

However, Ravta was busy looking at the body of the Gladys and Rivo. Both bodies were stirring.Rivo was the first one to wake up.

"What happened?" He said, surprised how part of the castle was now broken. After speaking, he realized that he was back inside his body.

"I'm back, but is she back?" He said, a bit happy and sad at the same time.

You and Ravta rushed towards Gladys as she begun to wake up. When her eyes opened, she saw the two of you.

She uttered three words.

Goblin limbs fly about and blood splatters across your breastplate. You don't show any mercy to the creatures that have been terrorizing the village. If anything, you feel as if you're being too kind to grant such swift deaths upon the pack.

"Hey! Wait for me." Calls out Selina as she runs over towards you with her skeletons following right behind.

You turn around to face Selina and quickly make up an excuse so you can try to get rid of her. "Look, I don't want you to get hurt, head back to wherever you came from and I'll deal with this okay?" This just only seemed to make her more determined though, as she smiled lightly.

"That's sweet and that trait of yours is exactly why I fell in love with you in the first place, but I can handle myself you know." Before you can react Selina grabs your left arm and holds it against herself happily. "I'm staying with you forever til the end of time."

"Right, and why exactly do you love me again?" You ask, perplexed. You don't quite remember any romantic moments between you and her. Unless she found trying to kill each other romantic.

"Oh, you silly, remember when we first met and how you protected me from the locals?"

"Uh..., oh right. The locals accused you of being evil and performing necromancy without any hard evidence. So I stepped in to protect you, but in the end it turns out you were practicing necromancy, and then you tried to kill me shortly thereafter."

"hehe, I wasn't trying to kill you, I just wanted to stay with you for eternity. In that moment when you stood up for me, I fell in love. Besides, I don't see why those villagers were so upset anyways. It's not like their dead relatives were even using their bodies anymore."

"..." For a second you paused, not sure how to respond to that. The only thing you could muster after a few seconds was the word. "Right..."

Suddenly the bushes in front of you stirred. Thinking it was the goblin Selina let go of you allowing you to move forward. You cautiously approached the bush, only for a goblin to sprint away in the opposite direction. He caught you by surprise, but he seemed slow enough that you could catch him. With vigor you chased after him, only to trip on a wire which triggered a trap. A needle came flying towards you, but to your luck the trap was built somewhat shoddily causing the needle to miss it's mark just barely. Whatever the case though, you'd have to be more careful in case there were any more traps ahead.

.You got back up and took it easy, jogging lightly after the goblin, all the while cautiously scanning and evading more traps the goblin has set up. Only your suddenly stopped by the goblin who now stands on a large rock with a gun in his hand.

"Don't move, or I'll shoot!"

You freeze in place. The goblin has you right where he wants you, and now there's nothing you can do but pray Selina shoots him first with a magic bolt or something.

"You too! Stand still."

You turn your head to the side to see Selina and her group of skeletons who are now all frozen in place, lest the goblin shoot one of you. From what you can tell this goblin is very smart, not only can he speak human language, but he even set up a few traps in a short amount of time. You weren't sure you'd be able to trick him that easily.

"Good, now say your prayers." The goblin aims at you with lightning speed, there's no way you can get out of the way in time.

BANG! The sound of a gunshot rings through the forest, only the bullet seems to have missed its mark entirely.

Your ears ring for a moment at the loud sound. Your temporary deafness fades however, and before you realize it the goblin seems to be screaming as a sword has been planted in his leg from behind. Blood seeps to the ground from his heavy wound, and somehow gets sucked back up into the sword, almost as if it's enchanting it.

"Yes..., I need more power." Says a deep voice of a middle aged man.

The goblin falls over and out from behind a figure climbs out from behind the rock, chopping off the goblins head, as blood flows into the sword.

"Th...thanks." You call out to the figure. "You really saved our skins."

The figure doesn't respond, and instead finishes draining up the blood of the goblin. An act that makes you feel very uncomfortable.

The figure now faces its attention towards you and begins charging at full speed.

You realize you have two choices now.

You can try to fight this enemy. With Selina on your side it should make things much easier.

Or optionally you can try to run away, and hopefully those traps the goblin set up might actually come in handy.

13133.content:
Goblins! Throughout the trees and small squad charges towards you. They are shouting war cries as come. You analyse them, they are about half your size, their armour is made up of mostly wood and cloth, leaving their limbs completely exposed.

Goblin’s were never known for their intelligence, or tailoring skills, but these seem to be a lower breed of goblins. You could take on three of them at once, and probably come out unscathed, but there are six, that you can see, that’s enough to put even your life on the line in a fight with them. Still, it looks as if you have no choice and draw your sword, with intent to kill.

The cursed bracelet seems to glow.
“Forgot I had that for a minute.” You think, hoping that it doesn’t drain your strength or stamina during the fight.

You wait until the goblins come to a few yards away from you before stomping your foot and yelling.

This stops the goblins momentum for a second, but only for a second, as they look at each other and realize they outnumber you.

The first one leaps at you, and you slice its head clean off. You turn around and stab the taller goblin in the gut, it falls over holding the wound in its stomach. Two of the goblins flee. You chop off the right leg and right arm of one in a single stroke.

The last goblin jumps on your chest, and uses his legs to kick you onto your back. Using his fists, he wails on you, as you drop the sword.

The following is a brutal fist fight between the two of you as you roll on the ground. It finally ends when the goblin tries to bite your face, but you hold up your arm, and it accidently chomps down on the bracelet, breaking his fangs in the process. As it whips its head back in pain, you surprise it by knocking its skull with a rock, and putting it out of its misery.

Your stupid cursed bracelet is glowing green, and an aura of light engulfs your body. You feel a tingling sensation, as you black out.

You wake up, and the sun is in a different part of the sky. You feel exposed. As you sit up, something doesn’t feel right. The world is much larger than it was this morning, it smells different too. You turn your head to look around, but find that that is different too. As you stand up, you see a green arm and jump back in terror.

The fall back doesn’t hurt. You feel tougher than before. Getting up again, you look at the hand. Your fingers seem thicker than before. You defiantly control it.

As a breeze blows, you feel a draft between your legs, and look down to see that you are not wearing pants. Your armor has been replaced by some pieces of wood, held together by string. As you stretch your legs apart, you see that your reproductive equipment is about to retract into your body. “No wonder goblins don’t feel the need for pants,” you think.

The sun feels hot, so hot that you understand why goblins spend most their time underground. You look at a ditch, still flooded from the heavy rain these lands faced just three days prior. You instinctively drop into the stale water, and open your eyes when entering. To your amazement, you can see fine under water. You don’t seem to have trouble breathing either. Miniature gills in your neck open and you feel content to stay here until darkness.

You see some bugs swim by, and open your mouth to allow it to enter. As this happens, you realize that goblins have just as much in common with frogs as they do with humans.

Inspired by this fact, you stand up from the water, and decide to try another experiment. The simple act of talking.

“I am human.” you try and say.
“Ayumeeeeee” you squeak.
You look at your hands, and move your fingers. Those work fine, but something is screwing up between your thoughts and your speech.
“I…” “Am…” “Hu…Man” you say very slowly, and realize that speaking this way is hurting your throat, no wonder Goblins don’t trade with humans much.

As you look down in the pool, the ripples clear, and you see the goblin looking back at you.

On different parts of your body you could see some nasty battle scars with the worst being on your right arm, right leg, and gut. Something you'd never set out doing, after all you fancied yourself a hero and heros don't kill humans for personal gain. But then again you'd never been in a position like you were now.

132.content:
A week has passed since you saved the village from the pack of goblins, but you barely remember that even happened. For a while, you tried to figure out a way to remove the cursed armlet, but just ignored it because it didn't seem to have any negative effects. You traveled from one distressed village to the next, discovering a far more dangerous problem.

Dragons were known to cause pollution problems or feast regularly on the residents of nearby villages, but it was exceedingly rare for a dragon to build its nest in the middle of a town. Twenty-four hours per day, a fierce red dragon ruled a small town with fear. The villagers weren't even allowed to leave. It was a stroke of luck that you happened to wander into town, right as the dragon was delivering an address to his subjects.

"And that is why I expect all citizens of the newly renamed Dragonsville to actively support my new, military initiative. As your ruling lord and protector, I promise to lead you all as the first step in my Grand Dragon Empire!"

"Are you a dragon or a politician?" you snap, and you march into the town square, with a battle axe slung over your shoulder.

The winged lizard cocked his head back and laughed hysterically, which resulted in a scatter shot of fireballs toasting a few faceless voters. "I don't know who you think you are, charging in here, but I'll make an example out of you, for anyone else who might be planning on betraying my protection!" The dragon flapped its wings once, and soared into the air. Another flap of its wings, and its jaws were above you. Around you. Behind you.

You were swallowed whole. Thinking quickly, you dig into the wall, rather, the dragon's throat, with your axe, and chop, chop, chop! The beast's words are muffled, but it cries out in agony at you gradually chop his head off from the inside out and finally spill back out into the town square.

The people cheer for their savior, and begin preparations for a celebration.
