1321.content:
As soon as you cleaved the head of the aspiring conqueror, you began feeling strange. Heartburn quickly sunk in, and then your entire body ached. As you writhe in pain on the ground, the villages back off, not sure what to think or how to help.

Though it kills just to open your eyes, you hold up your wrist. "The... Bracelet..." you say aloud, hearing your voice deepen and change into a roar with each syllable. As you stare at your hand, you notice your fingers are changing. Spiked claws are emerging from the tips, and hard red scales are coagulating all over. Finally the pain overtakes you, and you pass out.

When you awake, the pain is gone. You feel fantastic. Stronger than you ever have in your entire life. You're surrounded by the townspeople, who stare at you in fear. Also, they appear to have shrunk down, because they're only slightly taller than your... tail.

You launch yourself forward towards the spring in the plaza, desperate to get a look at your own reflection, but you knew your fate before you even reached the water. You could feel the wings on your back moving you. The feeling in your tail when it smashed against a building. The crushing stone when you landed. When you stare into the fountain, the very face of the dragon you had slain earlier was staring back at you. The cursed bracelet on your arm had grown with you.

You turn back to the villagers.
1321.title: Reborn

choices: Avoid them and went straight to the town
13211.content:
The villagers looked scared shirtless by your presence. You understood it a little. They just felt relieved that their tyrant ruler got vanquished, only to see their hero turn into the exact same monster afterwards. You moved slowly, careful not to break anything else. Everyone seemed to afraid to say anything, until someone who looked like former chief of the town before the dragon took over went forward.

"You... What are you?"

Though visibly scared, there was still a shred of dignity in his voice, as expected of someone who used to lead his town.

"I..." you felt surprised at your own booming voice, but continued, "I am the one who killed that dragon. This cursed bracelet must have turned me into him"

The chief listened to your explanation, then said, "then I and this town thank you, hero, for we have been saved from his tyranny. But now I must ask you, what are you going to do?"

You fell silent, unsure what to do yourself, when the chief continued, "as much as we feel grateful of your help, you cannot stay here, as your presence will bring back bad memories from that dragon. I will have to ask you to leave"

Sadness overcame you, as you realized they had abandoned you. But given your current condition, you knew you couldn't live among humans any longer. You nodded, and said you would leave immediately.

"But before that, I need to know where that Dragon's body is"

You said this because you didn't see an identical but dead dragon like you lying around. The chief, as if he knew you would ask this, waved his hand above his head. Two men came forward, bringing a cartwheel with them. On the cartwheel, something was covered with a large rag. The chief grabbed the rag, and you were shocked to see your body, all complete with your armor. The head was severed, much like how you killed the dragon earlier.

"As you were turning into a dragon, his corpse turned into you," the chief said.

You couldn't bear to look at it any longer, and, without saying anything else, flew upwards, sending gust of winds towards the surrounding townsfolks. You didn't know how to fly, but it seemed your new body remembered it. You flew towards the mountain, away from civilization.


*****


It had been a week since you turned into a dragon. You'd been living in a cave, quite high in the mountain, where you sure no one should wander around. You knew your days living with human was over, so you opted to live in seclusion. You never came down to villages to eat their lifestocks. You'd been feeding on forest dwellers such as deers and wolves, swallowing them whole in one gulp. You at first was worried that the bracelet would turn you into your prey, but fortunately that didn't happen. You still hadn't figured out the extent of its power, or how it was actually work.

You almost gave up and accepted living alone as a dragon for the rest of your life, until they came. A pair of hunters, much like what you used to be, wandered inside your territory (you unconsciously set one). You knew they were coming for you, so you came straight to them. Suddenly dropping in front of them out of nowhere seemed like a good greeting, so you did just that. The earth shook as you landed, and the two hunters fell backwards from the shockwave.

"M-master Birg! There it is! A d-d-dragon!"

One young woman was still on the ground, frantically pointing at you. The other, a middle aged man, however, was already on his feet, brandishing his spear.

"Don't falter, Catlyn! On your feet! Prepare yourself!"

"Y-yes master!" On his master's order, Catlyn rose to her feet and prepared her spear as well.

"You... Why have you two come here?" you boomed at them.

"Oh? So the beast can talk? I..." Birg said, but you cut him short.

"I AM NOT A BEAST! I USED TO BE HUMAN MUCH LIKE YOU!" you spew hot smoke as you roared.

"...oh? So the townsfolk's story were true?"

"What?" you were surprised at his remark.

"They called us, told us to exterminate a dragon up in the mountain. They promised lots of gold to us. They also telling crazy story about a man turning into a dragon, but I didn't believe that... Until now"

You felt silent. You had never bothered the town that you saved ever since you became a dragon. And yet they called hunters to slay you. You felt betrayed. Your one week living in seclusion felt useless. Why living here if in the end they still wanted to kill you? Your anger rose quickly, probably from dragon hormone or whatever, and you decided to take revenge. But before you could have your revenge, there were two obstacles in front of you.
13211.title: Feeling betrayed

132111.content:
Your anger couldn't be suppressed, you wanted to unleash your wrath on whoever came into view. And 2 people unfortunately were right in front of you.

"I'll make all of you pay!" you roared.

Wasting no time, you propelled backwards, using the strength of your legs and your wings, while spewing a stream of blazing hot fire right at Birg and Catlyn. The latter panic and dove to her left, kissing dirt in the process. Birg was more prepared. He jumped to his right, then gave chase. As you didn't jump back very far, he soon approached you. You attempted to gnaw at him, but he evade it swiftly, then thrust his spear right on your neck. You braced yourself for pain, but it never came. The thick scales on your neck deflected Birg's spear completely. He was surprised, but regained his composure, then quickly kept distance before you could strike back at him.

Just then you realized that thick, hard scales covered your whole body except your wings, nose and eyes. It was by pure luck and the dragon's arrogance when he attempted to eat you alive last week that you could kill him from inside, where his scales could not protect him. Surely, you wouldn't give Birg the same opportunity like what you had. You reminded yourself not to try to eat him, at least not alive.

Birg also realized it was near impossible to kill you by himself (even with Catlyn's help) no matter how skilled he was. But he knew you wouldn't just let him and Catlyn go unscathed.

"Catlyn!" he shouted, "plan C"

"What?!" Catlyn looked surprised.

"Just do it!"

You didn't know what plan C was, but you damn swear they would not succeed. You breath out more fire at Birg. He attempted another parry & attack, this time aimed at your wing. But you were more prepared this time and you used one of your front legs to knock him off. Birg lost his spear as he flew from your hit. Before he could stand up and recover it, you jumped right on top of him, crushing his body with your right front leg. Birg screamed in agony, you must have broke some of his bones. Feeling satisfied for now, you looked around for your second prey, but Catlyn was nowhere to be seen.

"An ambush?" you thought out loud, "no, she ran away. So I guess plan C was for you to sacrifice yourself so she can get away? How noble of you, "

"*cough* Please, don't hurt her... If you still have some humanity left," Birg was pleading at you.

"I had them, before you came here. Now, Catlyn, wasn't it? I believe she would want to meet with her master one last time," you said before taking off, bringing Birg along with you.

Several minutes later, you spotted Catlyn while you were very high in the sky. You heard Birg's plea once more, but you didn't care about it and did what you wanted. You let Birg go, made him free-falling hundreds of meters, then fell hard about 10 meters in front of running Catlyn. She was very surprised from your 'gift' that she stumbled and fell as she tried to stop. Looking up from the ground, she finally realized it was her master who was falling in front of her, now dead as he obviously didn't survive the fall.

"No... Master..." she was too shocked to properly react and still laid on her stomach.

When you landed not far behind her seconds later, Catlyn finally rolled over to see you, using her arm and elbow to propped herself up. She still laid on the ground, as if she didn't have the will to fight or run. You slowly inched closer towards her.

"You monster..." you heard her softly whispered at you.

"I guess I am one now," you replied.

You lifted your tail and, using its sharp end, stabbed Catlyn on her chest.
132111.title: Hope in Humanity: Lost

1321112.content:
You retracted your tail, and you watched as Catlyn drew her last breath. You readied yourself to fly, to unleash your wrath upon the traitorous town, when the bracelet on your arm started to shine again. You felt the burning sensation from before. You roared in pain, unintentionally breathed fire. Different than before, though, you felt yourself shrinking. Your claws retracted, scales disappearing, and your wings & tail shrinking as you transformed back into humanoid form.

This time, you tried your best to stay conscious. You needed to know what really happened to you. You kept shrinking and shrinking until you were a human again. You had hoped that maybe you're turning back into your old self, but then you knew it was not the case. The body proportion was off, and last time you remember, your hair didn't reach your back. Clothes materialized out of nowhere, draping your new body snugly. The pain started to subsided, and you found yourself on all four, panting hard and sweating. After a while, you inspected your body. Hand, face, breast, stomach, breast again, groin, legs. You were not sure during the transformation, but now you knew for sure you had Catlyn's body. You couldn't believe you became a woman, but at least you were human again.

You looked up and saw Catlyn's corpse, now turned into a dragon. It had a large wound on its chest. You then tried to stand up, feeling wobbly since you had been on four legs for the past week. You picked up Catlyn's spear and tried swinging it around. You never used a spear before, but just like when you knew how to fly as a dragon, it seemed Catlyn's body remember on how to use a spear. You tried to access her memories, but found you were unable to do so, just like with the dragon. This tells you a lot about the bracelet's power. But you didn't understand one thing. You thought the bracelet would swap you with whatever you kill, that's why you were worried you would turn into a deer or wolf when you ate them as a dragon. If that's the case, why didn't you turn into Birg and turned into Catlyn instead? You killed Birg first and nothing happened, but you turned into Catlyn after you killed her. You looked at the bloody mess that used to be Birg.

"Maybe it has something to do with the way I kill him..." you muttered.

You killed Birg indirectly by letting him plummeted to his death, while you killed Catlyn by stabbing her with your tail. So indirect killing would not activate the bracelet, only direct killing would. This explanation made sense, though it didn't explain the deer and wolf thing from before.

Meanwhile, your anger had subsided considerably. One was because the transformation provided a lot of distraction. Two, maybe because the dragon hormones no longer affected you. You took another note on the possibility of mental changes based on the body you inhabit. Also, you just realized that you had take over Catlyn's life. And if you returned to the town, you should get a reward for slaying the dragon. Or you could stick to your old plan to have your revenge.
1321112.title: Catlyn

13211121.content:
You checked your... Well, Catlyn's belongings. Catlyn carried a small bag around. Inside there were several dried food, a water container, a roll of gauges and several small bottles with clear liquid inside. You doubted that those were water, so you opened one of the bottles and took a whiff. It was odorless, so you dipped the tip of your little finger into the liquid and licked it. It was somewhat bitter, and you immediately spat it out. From your experience, you knew that it was probably poison as some hunters relied on it. You closed back the bottle and put it back into your bag. Thinking for a moment, you took out the gauges and rolled it around your still snuggly fit cursed bracelet. It was a little too big of a cover, but it would still fool people if you said that you got wound there. Now that the bracelet wasn't visible anymore, you started your long walk back to the town.

About an hour later, you finally arrived. Not much had changed since your last visit, but you could see that some buildings were being repaired. A townsfolk who saw you immediately ran towards you after telling someone else to give words to the elder. He leads you towards a house, must be where the elder lived. The front door was open, and you entered following the man. Inside, the elder was waiting for you with several other people.

"You are rather fast. Have you been able to slay the dragon?"

You only answered the elder's question with a nod. The people around cheered, but the elder remained calm and made another inquiry.

"Where is your companion?"

The townsfolks went silent as they heard the question. With monotone voice and the saddest face and you could fake, you answered shortly, "he died." Afterwards, you tried faking tears too, which was surprisingly easy. You wondered whether this was also from your current body's hormones or something.

The elder gestured the others to go out, and they obliged. After they had went out and closed the door, the elder started to talk to the still sobbing girl in front of him.

"I am very sorry for your loss, miss..."

He stopped talking, as if waiting for your response. But you kept weeping to yourself. He stop waiting and rummaged through one of the shelf instead. Hidden behind it was a small leather pouch which gave clunking sound as he put it on the table.

"Here you go, 100 gold coins we promised. And as our token of sympathy, I'll personally add 25 gold coins for your loss. Would you accept it?"

100 gold coins was enough for more than a year of comfortable life. Not extravagant, but comfortable for sure. If only you didn't have that cursed bracelets with you, you would be having a nice life right now, as the original slayer of the dragon (even though that was almost by pure luck). So now, even if as Catlyn, you had every right to that.

"...thank you," you softly said.

"Don't mention it. We also planned to have a party for you, actually, but that seems rather inappropriate now, isn't?" You only nodded weakly at that, "I thought as much... Looks like your arm is injured, I'll tell a healer to treat you soon"

You definitely didn't want that fake wound to be treated, "no, it is alright... Elder, can I tell you something?"

"Yes?"

"Before we went to the mountain, you told us that this dragon used to be human, right? We actually didn't believe you," you repeated what Birg told you, "but when we met this dragon, he confirmed your story"

"So he did..." the elder mused at your story, "what else did he tell you?"

"He was angry that even though he never disturb your town after he turned into a dragon, you still sent us to hunt him. Is this true? That he never actually harmed your town?" You knew the answer, but you asked anyway.

"...yes, he was telling the truth," the elder said after a long pause.

"So why?" you felt your anger rose.

"We were afraid... Knowing an identical dragon that were terrorizing our town was still around nearby. We know it was actually our saviour, but the townsfolks keep having this nightmares about the dragon. It made us restless, not knowing when another dragon would attack us once more. So after a town meeting, we decided that this was for the best"

"The best for you, not for the former saviour," your anger kept building as you listened to his reasoning

"The best for my people, yes..." there was no hesitation in his words.

You almost couldn't take it anymore. You could kill him right then and there. You had the body of a young hunter, clumsy at times but a hunter nonetheless, while he was just an aging, wrinkled old man. Even if he knew how to defend himself, you were positive that Catlyn could easily overpower him. And everyone else was waiting outside, as long as you acted fast, nobody will be able to help him.
13211121.title: Back to Town

choices: Continue your life as a hunter
Lay low and live a quiet life for a while from the prize gold
132111211.content:
Quietly, you reached into your bag and snatched one of the poison bottles while walking forward to pick up the pouch of gold. You uncorked the bottle with one hand and hid it behind you. The old man didn't seem to notice, he just nodded as you picked up the coins. After the pouch was in your bag, you walked around the table to get close to him.

"Elder... There is something else that I need to tell you"

"What is it?"

He seemed to grow weary, you need to act fast. Suddenly, you lunged with your free hand and started to choke him. Surprised, he opened his mouth wide, where you easily shoved the poison on your other hand into it. The bottle was drained in a second, and you forced him to swallow it all. His horrified eyes met your furious ones. A moment after, he started to spasm. You held him still until he stopped moving completely before slowly lowered him down to the floor. After closing his mouth and empty eyes, you put the empty bottle back into the bag and then walked outside. Once you opened the door, you shouted to several people waiting.

"Help! The elder! He fainted!"


*****


The villagers believed that you had nothing to do with the elder's death. The poison was untraceable, they didn't have a healer to examine him closely. Besides, it turned out that the elder had health problems lately. You decided that one death was enough for your revenge, so you wiped all hatred towards the villagers from your heart.

You were given a room to spend the night, before you left the town at dawn. But honestly, you were at lost on what to do. You had a new identity without a memory, and to make it worse, it is a female one. Moreover, you wondered what you should do if you met someone who knew Catlyn.
132111211.title: Revenge is a Dish Best Served as a Drink

choices: Go to your old guild or find another way
1321112112.content:
Hiding won't solve any problems, this cursed bracelet of yours need to be taken off. You had tried to think of several ways to do it. One was to break it by force. But seeing a dragon's strength couldn't destroy it, you doubt you or someone you knew could break it. Another one was to cut your hand off together with the bracelet, but you couldn't bring yourself to do it. The third one was to find someone who was knowledgeable about these type of thing and asked him or her to remove it. But you didn't know anyone like that, so you would need help.

Typically, hunters such as you and Catlyn registered themselves to a local hunter guild. It functions as a middle-man for quests from nearby villages and towns, giving shelter for the hunters, and a place for information trade. The guild would take small portion of the hunter's earnings, but the benefits was more than enough for most people, you yourself included. Catlyn must be registered in a guild of a big town nearby. You just need to find another settlement, ask where the nearest hunter guild was, and you'd eventually arrive.

The question was, however, whether you wanted to go there in the first place. That guild only registered Catlyn as their member, not you. This wasn't your area, you've been away from home for a couple of years. The guild that you're in was very far from where you were. Moreover, you told them you'd resign and traveled away, so you wasn't sure they would still help you. On the other hand, Catlyn's guild was nearby, and you're now essentially Catlyn, so they might be eager to help. But what if they realized you had killed Catlyn and Birg? What would they do then?
1321112112.title: Life Goes On

13211121121.content:
You can't waste precious time and energy trying to go back to your hometown. It's just too far and perilous. Besides, who knows what else you had to kill to get there. It'd be a shame to become something else again after finally returned into a human, albeit a different gender. You decided to go to Catlyn's guild for help instead.

You followed the small road from the previous village. Remembering your days as the dragon, when you could fly high and see from the above, you tried to decide the direction of the nearest town. You never saw another town beside the one that tried to kill you, but you saw a highway. It must've lead to somewhere, so you decided to head that way. You walked for nearly an hour before you found it. Although called a highway, it was nothing fancy, just a dirt road wide enough for two carriages to pass by unhindered. You picked a direction and started walking. You were lucky, several minutes after, two horses was strutting along the road, pulling a cart filled with straws. A kind old man was holding the reins, and he offered a ride, which you gratefully took. Even luckier, the road you and the old man took headed towards the biggest town in the area, which was also the headquarter of Catlyn's guild. You sat peacefully, occasionally chatting with the old man, enjoying the company of another human after a long time of solitary as a dragon. Although most of the time it was only the old man who spoke to himself, you didn't mind and enjoyed his talking.

A couple of hours fly by, and you arrived at the town. Saying your thanks and good byes to the old man, you asked a random person about the location of the hunter's guild, praying hard that he didn't recognize Catlyn. He didn't, and he pointed the direction of the guild. You strode along quickly towards it. Arriving in front of the building, it wasn't much to look at. At least not much bigger than your previous guild. Calming yourself down, you walked inside.

"Oh, Catlyn! You're back!"

A woman behind a counter, seemingly a receptionist of this guild, immediately spoke toward you as you entered. Several heads of the people standing or sitting around the guild's hall turned to look at you, but they quickly lost interest and went back to their own business. You slowly approached the woman.

"Umm, yeah..." you quietly spoke.

"That's great, I was so worried when Birg insisted that he wanted to take this job with just the two of you. But I guess you two can handle it, eh?" she said cheerfully, "by the way, where is Birg?"

You knew it was coming, so you just answered flatly, "...he didn't make it"

You said it softly, but it was as if you shouted it out, as now every head in the room turned towards you, and they stayed that way. The woman looked especially shocked as she covered her wide open mouth with her hands. Awkward total silence filled the room for several seconds, all the while you made uneasy expression. You knew you should act sad, but you're not much of an actor so you decided against it lest it backfired. Beside, it was difficult to feel sad about the death of a stranger who wanted to kill you. You decided to break the ice before you lost the opportunity to demand it.

"Can I speak to the guild master?"

"O-oh, yes... Yes, of course. Please wait for a second," the woman quickly walked towards the back.

Soon various whispers were heard across the room, undoubtedly they were all about you and Birg. Several people started walking towards you. Without turning back, you fend them off.

"Please, leave me alone for now," you said softly.

It was enough, all of them backed off. The whispers didn't die out, though. A couple of minutes later, the woman returned. She then urged you to meet the guild master.

"Zack is waiting for you, Cat..." she said.

"Thank you..."

You walked away without saying anything else, leaving the hall behind. Moments later, you knocked on the door to Zack's, the guild master's, room. You opened without waiting for a reply. A rigid faced man with goatee sat alone inside the well furbished room. Both you and him said nothing, but he gestured you to sit down on a chair in front of his desk. You obliged.

"I heard about what happened to Birg from Diane. Is it true?" he finally spoke.

"Yes"

"I see... You seemed awfully calm about this, Catlyn... Run out of tears to shed?"

You said nothing and looked down, hiding your face with your long bangs.

"...sorry for that. Mind telling me in details of what happened?"

Did you tell him the absolute truth, saying who you really were? Or lie, keep pretending as Catlyn?
13211121121.title: Go to Catlyn's guild

133.content:
Quickly saying your farewells, you start your long trek to the city you'd come from. You're handed a large bounty for the many jobs you'd done for the village, incliding the Goblin hunting, and your equipment; within a few hours of waking you're gone and marching onwards.

A few days of nothingless pass by as you walk. You pass small huts, passing travellers and even a war-band or two but nothing eventful happens and soon you're in the mountains. According to the villagers, going right through them was by far the fastest way to the city, albiet more dangerous yet that was no problem for veteran fighters and experianced warriors like you.

The moutains were cold, wind biting into you as you march down the path. Luckily for you, the local Ranger's Guild had spent years building a route through the moutains for travellers. It had been cut into the cliff-face with strong wood and stone bridges jumping over the gaps between the moutains, long ravines cascading down below. The area around you was gorgeous, lush forests and meadows all around you for as far as you can see. Yet these marvels had become the normal for hours of walking at this point and it was getting weary. You'd do anything for something to break up your day at least a little.

Then you hear it.

A sound ahead.

You slow down, being sure to stay quieter as you turn a corner, peeking around. You see a carrage, surrounded by bodies and splattered with blood. By the looks of it, it had been ambushed but by who? Your question is answered when you see three orcs talking to each other. Two of them are males, one had a scar on its face and the other a large black mohawk. Both are clad in a mixture of plate, fur and leather armour, mismatched and pieced together. The woman, however, was differant. She was dressed in a darkened metal bikini that was accented by sliver fur and a silver metal lining. She had a large black bow on her back, a quiver of arrows with it and a silver and black blade on her hip. By the looks of it, it was a very well-made item.

slowly, you retreat back into cover and consider your three options; you could either try to sneak past them, lure them out and kill them one at a time or you could attack and use the element of surprise to your advantage.

152.content:
It was supposed to be a simple mission. A quest just to fill your coin purse a little. Something easy. And yet, it was anything but easy.

You and your companion(s) had just finished training a few months ago under your respective teachers. And now you had all reached a point where physically and mentally you were all strong enough to forge on ahead with the new journeys that awaited you. Your first few missions had been relatively easy, and while this one was no different, just a simple quest to rid the local farmers of a creature terrorizing their crops, what awaited you instead was something neither of you were expecting.

The creature in question looked like a blue deer with long antlers that branched every which way. It's fur was shaggy, and it had five slender tails that ended in a bit of fuzz. While preparing to kill it, it noticed your presence at the last second and bolted away. You chased after it but it was to fast, Only this was all part of the plan. While you were chasing after it your other part member(s) had snuck up on it from the other side, thus surrounding it. Popping out from their hiding place the creature realized it was trapped, and in a last ditch effort hit all of you with a beam fired from each of its tails. The beam was slow moving and wasn't to big of a problem, only as you dodged out of the way the beam arced towards you, which was extremely surprising. You were not able to dodge, and immediately blacked out despite feeling no pain.

First things first though. How many party members were in your group?

1521.title: An adventure for two

15211.content:
You were Jack Lantern, a freshly full pledged member of the infamous rogue guild in Mallow Kingdom, Scavenger. The guild took you in when you was but a boy, living in the street, pickpocketing people for living. Now the guild was not particularly noble, the members were sellswords, mercenaries if you may say, that would do most job with proper payment. But that could be considered as honest work in this dangerous and cruel world, and they despised thieves despite being called a rogue guild. Long story short, the reason was that they had a bitter past with a certain thief guild. They took you in, taught you well, and now you were ready to become one of them. But you had to make a name for yourself and gained a lot of experience before you could take the guild's mostly-dangerous official missions. So they sent you out alone, to return when you had enough experience.

You then went to the nearest town to find some work to do. That was when you met her. Crystal Wintermonth, the wandering priestess. Her mother was an ex-high priestess, once had a place in central church, famous for her skill in spearman-ship, until she was banished for committing adultery. Hence, she lived in seclusion, raising her daughter by herself, teaching her everything she knew. Since they rarely met other people, Crystal grew up to be a timid person. However, one day she found out that her mother was ill. She still could do day to day activities, but the sickness slowly was eating her health away. They barely had any valuables so they couldn't afford any healers or medicine. Crystal knew she had to make money if she wanted to stay with her mother longer, so with her mother's blessing (although she was reluctant at first), Crystal went away.

Being timid, Crystal found that it was difficult to find a job since it required communicating with other people. Her mother also told her that it was better to have a companion, but she wasn't even able to properly order a drink at the inn, let alone finding a partner in arms. That was when you found her. Being a beautiful young girl, Crystal often got harassed by perverts, and that day at the inn was no different. Crystal could only helplessly fend them off unsuccessfully, surrounded by those beast when you entered the inn.

Once again, the guild Scavenger was not particularly noble, but they did have several ethic codes to be obeyed by all members. One of them was to help any encountered damsel in distress (and if possible, to ask for something in return later). Following the code, you went to help her. No violence was involved. By merely pretending to be her close friend, you made the offenders hesitated when they saw the Scavenger insignia on a scarf, tied on your right arm. Being in a famous guild had its perks as they slowly left you two alone.

Later, in a very quiet voice you almost couldn't hear, Crystal thanked you. You asked what her business was in that village and then you two traded some stories. You were a little disappointed that you couldn't get anything from a poor priestess, but you welcomed Crystal to accompany you to find jobs. As your teacher always said, the more people in your group the better, especially if they were beautiful girls. Your teacher was a huge pervert and it somewhat rubbed off on you. Crystal was overjoyed by your invitation, but once again failed to properly thank you.

That was a couple of weeks ago.


*****


You groaned as you slowly regained consciousness. You couldn't believe you were that careless. To fell to such attack, your teacher would kill you if he found out.

"That damn animal is going to pay," you silently promised inside.

As you opened your eyes, you tried to sit up. You felt something were off but couldn't figured out what. Your head hurt as hell, so you reached out with your hand. Instead of your short shaggy hair, though, you felt silky smooth hair on your hand. Surprised, you retracted your hand quickly that some of the hair flung out into your vision. They were long, which was not how it supposed to be, and instead of black, it was blue-ish white. You looked blankly at your now slender hand. Then you looked down and saw them, a pair of breast pushing through a white blouse.

"What the..."

You started to say, before snapping your mouth shut. You recognized the voice that went out of your mouth not as yours, but of your 2 weeks old companion. You looked around and finally saw another body lying down which looked like you. In fact, it was your body indeed.

"You've gotta be kidding me..."

Somehow, you ended up in Crystal's body. Well, the 'how' part was actually quite obvious. It must be that monster's vault. The real question was, what happened to Crystal.

You took a deep breath, trying to calm yourself down. Then you got up and approached your body. It was you, alright, still in your black shirt and trousers. It appeared to have no injuries, as with Crystal's body. You then shook it, feeling a little relieved when it started to wake up. After it opened it's eyes, it quickly sat up and looked around. When it finally saw you, its face showed horror and disbelief.

"Crystal?" you softly asked.

The response you got was a loud shriek and instant back jump, before crawling on all four. Several short shrieks followed after it turned back to see you.

"Yep, that's her," you sighed inside.

It might be only 2 weeks, but you got to spend a lot of time together so you knew most of her behaviour already. Your teacher taught you how to read a person's personality, anyway, which helped much. Crystal was still screaming, by the way.

"Crystal, please stop screaming with my voice, it sounds... Weird..." 'Pathetic' was the word you wanted to say, but you decided against it.

She soon stopped. But it seemed that Crystal had just realized the condition she was in as she now looked down on her body, seeing your body instead of hers, and then continued her screams. Her screams made your headache worse, but you wouldn't even bother telling her to stop again. Eventually, Crystal calmed down somewhat.

"J-jack?" she stammered, which you replied with a nod.

"Wh-what happened?"

"Must be that last attack... Probably it was its special power or something, and it made us swap bodies like this"

"N-no... I don't want this!" Crystal started to panic again.

"Calm down, we will find a way to reverse this... Maybe we can figure it out if we captured that beast... But it will be difficult..." you pondered.

"You... You seem very calm about all this..." Crystal said to you.

"Hmm? Well, you could say, I have somewhat plenty experience about this kind of thing," you said while smiling bitterly.

Your teacher had a close friend who was a wizard and whenever they met up, your teacher always tag you along. They often made you his guinea pig, trying out new potions and spells he made. Most of them were successful, unfortunately the effects were as ugly as intended. One time your nose grew very long, other time you grew a pair of goat horns, another time your skin turned into rainbow color, once you were transformed into a dog for a full day, etc. They never turned you into a girl like this, though, which was surprising since that wizard was as perverted as your teacher.

Bottom line was, there were many unpleasant things happened to you, but they were all reversible, so this one must be too. That's what you believed.

"We will try to capture that one, but I don't think it is going to return to the farm soon, so we will have to find it inside the forest," you told Crystal.

"Well then, l-lets go..." she said while standing up.

"Hold it, it is way past noon. It will be dark in a few hours. We better start looking tomorrow. Besides, there is another important thing to do"

"W-what is it?"

"Tell me, do you know how to use a sword?" you asked her, which prompted Crystal to shake her head, "well, I also only know little about using a spear. My teacher used sword so I followed his style"

"What are you saying?"

"I'm telling you we will have to stick to our old weapon, but we have different bodies right now. There will be differences in height, weight, strength and balance, so we have to get used to our bodies ASAP if we want a chance to capture that monster tomorrow," you explained.

"I... I understand..." Crystal said softly.

"Good, now give me my sword"

You traded weapons. First you tried to practice on your own. Crystal's body was only somewhat shorter than you, and the difference in weight was not that great either. The problem would be in strength as Crystal only focused her training on her arms to swing her spear, which made her leg not as strong. Meanwhile, you relied on your leg a lot to run, dodge and kick down opponents. You would have to change your fighting style. Also, with the extra weight on your chest which was nonexistent when you were a man, added with several other anatomical differences, your sense of balance was hugely overthrown. Crystal also seemed to have difficulties in getting used to your body.

A couple of hours later, you two tried mock battle. Your movements were so awkward that you were sure you would be killed quick if you faced a tough enemy. Crystal wasn't any better. You decided to stop about an hour before sun set and got back to the inn.

In the end, the result of your training was...
15211.title: A Couple of Rookie

choices: You have to go pee as well.
It might be a little easier to use the spear with Crystal's body.
152112.content:
You felt ashamed after all that practice with Crystal. Sure you had still retained all your skill, but with this new body of yours you weren't able to pull off that many techniques. Your new body just didn't have the right muscles for the job. Couple that with your new height, weight, and sense of balance You sighed as you looked at Crystal who was in your body. She didn't do that well either. Her attacks were sloppy and awkward, but what really surprised you was that her spear had not lit up at all. The holy magic inside laid dormant the whole time as strange as it was. Normally it would shine a little as it became stronger with her own magic. You pondered your situation and tried to think of a way out of this mess. Your current level of skill would leave you dead to even the simplest bandits. If only there was some way you could get your body back. You bit your lip and thought hard, but you ultimately could not come up with any solution.

You looked at Crystal for a moment and felt a bit bad for her. You were used to these kinds of things given your prior experience with your mentor, but Crystal was not. You felt a little guilty as you were the one who had accepted this mission without telling Crystal beforehand, even though you knew she most likely would have agreed to it anyways.

You shook your head slightly. Thoughts like these wouldn't help you get your bodies back. So there was no point in thinking like that. As time passed on you both decided to head towards bed. Maybe it was only temporary? Whatever the case a fresh mind might just help you overcome this problem. As you entered Crystal's room you realized that changing into pajamas was going to be a bit of a problem. You mulled your options over in your head before ultimately deciding to just sleep in your current clothes, minus the shoes and socks. Not only did this make it harder to sleep, but the new weight on your chest made you uncomfortable. Hours past and soon you fell asleep, only to awaken to the sound of a knock on the door a few hours later. You rubbed your eyes groggily and opened the door to see your body which was jumping up and down with excitement. "What's got you so excited in the morning?" You asked, surprised at her energetic enthusiasm she gave off. Most of the time she was mostly reserved and quiet, so this was a bit new to you.

"H...how do you go to the bathroom?" Crystal asked uneasily.

You jumped back a bit realizing that she wasn't jumping with excitement, but merely had to go pee. "Uh..." You thought for a second, wondering how to best answer the question. "Just, you know, hold, aim, and fire." You told her in a somewhat awkward manner.

She looked frustrated with your answer, but ultimately accepted it as she ran off to use one of the various outhouses in the back.

As you watched her run off in your body you realized something...
152112.title: Unsuccessful

choices: You found nobody that could help
1521122.content:
It was not going to work, you concluded. You thought it was the best course of action to stick with your own weapon, but now you realized it was a foolish idea. If you forced yourself to use your sword, it would take weeks or even months for you to get used using it with your current body. You couldn't afford to wait that long. You looked back inside at your sword. It was a birthday gift from your teacher a few years ago, and you had been using it since. It was well maintained, so it would still serve you for many years. But now you'd have to temporary part with it.

You exited your room and walked toward Crystal's. It was unlocked so you went straight in. Her spear laid on the bed, and you took it, analysing it with both your eyes and arm. It felt heavier than your sword, but it strangely felt comfortable in your arm. As much as you would like to try it, swinging a spear inside would be dangerous somewhat, so you carried it to the outside.

Once outdoor, you tried a few basic swing and thrust. Although you were mainly taught about using sword and melee fight, you were also taught on how to properly use a spear in case you lost your weapon or something. You were not very good with it, though. However, again this spear seemed easy to use, and none of your moves were awkward like when you tried to use your sword.

"Well, this is going better than expected..." you muttered.

You decided it would be best for you to use Crystal's spear. You knew how to use a spear, and Crystal's body seemed to remember how to use the spear. The same thing wouldn't easily be said about Crystal and your sword, though. She said she didn't know how to use a sword before. Besides, sword was not your only weapon as you also often used a lot of melee moves in a fight. She would have more trouble than you if you went with this kind of weapon choice.

"Wh-what are you doing?"

You were so engrossed in practicing and thinking that you didn't realise Crystal was standing nearby. You stopped immediately.

"Oh, hey Crystal... Finished your businesses already?"

"What are you doing with my spear?" she paid no attention to your joke.

"Oh this? Well..." you wanted to explain but Crystal cut you short.

"Give it back!"

Crystal rushed forward, trying to forcefully took her spear away from you. You instinctively moved back, making her unable to do what she wanted. This just pissed her more.

"I said give it back!"

This is the first time in 2 weeks you see her being this... emotional. She always seemed reserved almost every time and about every thing.

"Whoa, calm down Crystal," you somehow still stubbornly tried to keep the spear away from her as you two struggled.

"That is my mother's spear! Give it back!"

"Ooh, so that's why..." you thought.

You relented, and gave her the spear. As soon as she got it, she held it tight while glaring at you. Feeling guilty, you apologized and explained at her.

"You said we should stick to our weapon yesterday," she said after she listened to your explanation.

"I know, and I am sorry but I was wrong. You knew how we were at the end of the day. We couldn't pull it off. So I guess this is time to reconsider the other option, which is trading our weapon"

Crystal went silent, seemed deep in thought. She looked doubtful.

"...but I don't know how to use a sword"

"I'll teach you the basics. I have a feeling my body remembers how to wield it so it wouldn't be too difficult for you"

"...do you know how to handle a spear?"

"Yes, I do. I learned how to use it during my training, which I mentioned to you yesterday"

"...but you don't know how to use the magic"

You know Crystal was making excuses, so you went straight at what made her hesitate.

"Then teach me. Crystal, don't worry... I will take care of your mother's legacy," you said while smiling at her.

She looked shocked at your words. A couple of seconds later her expression turned into anger again. Crystal suddenly thrust her spear right on your stomach. You felt the hit, and fell on your knees.

"My mother is still alive, you idiot!"

Loudest shout you ever heard, both from her and your own voice since you never screamed like that. Good thing she was still sensible and used the back side of the spear when she hit you. You felt like you wanted to throw up, though.

"Sorry," you muttered while holding the pain.

A few moments of silence later, you heard Crystal sighed above you. You looked up, still kneeling on the dirt.

"I understand... I'll do as you say," she gave up.

The morning was spent with both of you getting familiar with each other's weapon, as well as giving pointers on each other skills. As you expected, Crystal had more trouble than you did, and she was only a little better than yesterday when she used her spear. You yourself didn't have much problems, except you still couldn't tap into Crystal's magic 100%. Scratch that, you couldn't even reach half of it. The magic in the spear activated twice or thrice but failed to activate most of the time. And none of her healing magic was casted from your hand.

Feeling enough practice, however, you moved to another problem, "looks like we couldn't get that monster by ourselves, not like this at least. That's why I have been thinking of getting another person to help us. Maybe an experienced hunter who lived around the area or mercenaries like us"

"But we don't have any money to pay them..."

"I know, that's why I plan to give all of our reward for this job, so it is actually like transferring the job," you explained, "I think losing this job is better than stuck like this for a long time, don't you think?"

"...I suppose you are right"

"Well then, I am off to find help. You should keep practicing"

"Wait!" Crystal stopped you by grabbing your shoulder.

"What?"

She eyed you suspiciously, "you... haven't taken a bath nor change clothes since yesterday, have you?"

"Err... No? So?"

"You want to wander around in my body like this?! Unacceptable! Go wash yourself! Or at least change your clothes!"

When you looked at her again, you realised she had changed into another pair of your clothes. You just remembered that Crystal was a somewhat neat freak. Maybe she wanted to keep that reputation intact. Well, you wouldn't like a dirty woman yourself.

"Okay, okay... I'll do it first..."

She let go of your shoulder. But as soon as you turned around and walked a couple of steps, she did it again.

"Wait!"

"Now what?"

Her face went as red as tomato. Now that she had your face, you felt really uncomfortable looking at it.

"If you do that... You will s-see my body," she whispered, but loud enough for you to hear.

"Well duh, how do I supposed to do it without looking? Blindfold myself? Besides, you already see my... *cough* So there is no need to be shy about this anymore"

"Of course there is!" Crystal shouted softly.

"Well, make up your mind, then! Should I stay dirty or not?"

Crystal went quiet. It looked like she wouldn't be able to decide so you would decide it by yourself.

"I'll wash myself now..."

As you walked away, Crystal made no attempt to stop you. You went to her room and took a fresh set of clothes and went to the bathhouse. It was a little disappointing that the public bathhouse was empty. You thought back about Crystal's hesitation for letting you saw her body, but it disappeared as you undressed yourself in the bathhouse. You smiled at your own reflection and naked Crystal smiled back at you from the mirror.

At first everything went well. You took it for granted to feel around in various places you didn't have as a male. However, as you applied soap all over your body, you realised something. On Crystal's back, there were several... No, many deep slash marks, which now remained as scars. It appeared to be quite old. The wounds were treated well, you could tell. What could possibly the cause of this? As you were wondering about those scars, you forgot any perverted thoughts and finished your bath quickly.

Silently promising that you would ask her about those scars someday, you dried yourself, redressed, combed your long hair, and went to find some help.
1521122.title: An Exchange of Weapon

choices: Run away and regroup with Crystal
15211221.content:
It didn't take very long before you were finally able to recruit someone for your mission. At one of the local taverns you found two people who were willing to help you. One of them was a slim but muscular elf who was skilled with both knife and bow, and the other one was a very strong looking man wielding a mace and shield. They didn't seem to be the most skilled but they were pretty decent from the demonstrations they gave. Now all you had to do was locate Crystal so you could all work on the mission and hopefully swap back to your original bodies. As you neared the entrance of the inn you were staying at you turned back towards the two guys telling them to wait there until you got your partner, they nodded, waiting outside the inn.

Knocking on Crystal's door you had to wait momentarily before the door unlocked and out stepped Crystal. She glanced to the side away from you, knowing you had seen her naked earlier. This served to make things quite awkward. "I found two guys who can help us." You said, in an effort to lighten the mood a little. Crystal kept glancing away but nodded slightly as you both made your way out of the inn where you found both of the men again.

"Yo, my name is Alfoz." Said the archer.
"And mine is Jonol, it's a pleasure to meet you." Said the maceman.

Crystal eyed them and said back. "N...nice to meet you as well." She gave a half smile before looking back towards you, a bit shy around the new members.

Silence filled the air for a moment, but you quickly broke it.

"So, uhm, about the mission. The creature in question we're looking for is a blue stag-like creature with horns that branch every which way, and it also has multiple tails. Last we saw it ran off into the forest." You told the two men.

"Oh, I saw that creature this morning. It was near one of the lesser dirt road, foraging for food most likely." Said Alfoz, crossing his arms triumphantly.

Both you and Crystal perked up at this moment and were excited to at least have some idea of what was going on. "Y...you saw it?" You smiled.

"That's what I just said, right?" Alfoz smiled back.

"Alright lead the way then." You said as you all began walking towards the dirt road.

Walking along it for about an hour with weapons in hand you still failed to see the creature. You cursed your luck. Finding this creature wasn't going to be easy was it? Suddenly a bush started to shake and out popped the creature, its ears twitching. Without even thinking you all began to chase after it, but it began sprinting away. Alfoz fired a few arrows but all of them seemed to miss just barely due to the creature's extreme agility. Before long it was completely out of sight.

"Let's split up into groups of two and catch it off guard." Said Jonol.

You all agreed with the plan and you found yourself paired up with Jonol. A couple of minutes were spent searching before Jonol stopped dead in his tracks. "I'm going to try climbing this tree to search for the creature hold on a second."

"Oh sure thing." You said as you clutched Crystal's spear.

Jonol despite being big gracefully climbed the tree with ease and looked out into the distance, looking at the surrounding open areas for the creature.

Jonol stopped climbing and hopped out from the tree moving towards you, snickering ever so slightly to himself.

"Did you find the creature?" You asked hoping for a good answer, only for Jonol to pull you into a hug.

"You smell nice." He said in a rather creepy way as he smelled your hair deeply.

You pushed him back. "W...what are you doing?" You asked angrily.

Before you could react he grabbed your shirt and started pulling at it trying to take if off of you. As he pulled on it you quickly knocked his hand away with the staff of the spear.

Jonol stopped as you did this shaking in anger. "Y...you ungrateful BITCH!" He lunged at you with his mace swinging it full force. You narrowly dodged it as the mace hit a tree splintering the bark, as small wood fragments began to scatter all around. He really wasn't messing around was he. "Now do as I say or else you're going to die here."

You clutched your spear tightly, not sure if you would be able to beat him given your current predicament. You had practiced a little but was it enough? If only you had your own body, you could easily beat this fool, heck even Crystal could probably beat him as she was skilled as well, but in these new bodies your old talents didn't matter that much. Your only option was to fight, or run away, and you were having trouble making a decision.

"Don't even try to use that spear on me." Jonol said smirking. "Just leave it on the ground and do whatever I say. Then give the spear to me so I can sell it. I'm sure it's worth more than whatever payment you would receive from some deadbeat farmer."

As he said this you heard your body scream for help from far away. In fact you were having trouble making it out. "Help, Alfoz is attacking me."

You now realize you've been had, they weren't after the money from the job at all, but rather for whatever valuables you had on yourself. You looked at Crystal's spear and the ornate designs on it. This weapon really would sell for a lot of money, but you weren't going to give it up either, least of all let some guy take advantage of you.

Quickly coming to a decision you decided you had no choice but to...
15211221.title: A pair of pairs

152112211.content:
There was no choice. Running away wouldn't help, you had to fight him. There was no way you could go to where Crystal was without getting attacked from behind. At least you could see his attacks if you decided to fight, unlike when you ran away.

Jonol brandished his weapon toward you, there was no time to hesitate. You readied yourself, taking a stance that you knew. Once you learned from your teacher that lances were not a very effective weapon against axes or maces such as his. But once again, you didn't have much choice. You stayed where you were, waiting for his attack since attacking him first was a reckless and dangerous move, given your situation right now.

"You sure you want to do this? I had no intention of hurting you, you know?" Jonol tried to sweet talk you again.

"Like hell you would," you cussed, "not after what you did to that tree bark"

"Well, if you insist..."

With swift and quick movement unexpected of a man with a body-build like him, Jonol tried to attack you again. You kept dodging every attack, waiting for a chance to attack back. One wrong movement and you'd be knocked unconscious. Jonol started to get irritated.

"Stop dodging!"

You stayed silent, focusing your power to activate Crystal's magic inside you, which you kept failing to do so for the last couple of minutes. Jonol's attacks got more and more erratic, but there was still no chance for you to hit him back as his attacks were surprisingly very coordinated. Then, something unexpected happened...

*ROAR*

Loud would be an understatement, you had never heard a beast's roar as loud as that. It source was somewhere near, and unfortunately from the same direction you heard Crystal's screams for help earlier. Whatever that was, it was possible that Crystal was in even more danger now.

"WH-WHAT THE HELL ARE YOU?!"

That sounded like Alfoz. Seemed like they were really in danger. Jonol was surprised at the roar, and even more when he heard Alfoz. He stopped attacking you and just starred at the direction the commotion happened. Meanwhile you were quite distracted yourself, but quickly managed to regain your concentration and luckily able to summon and fuse the light magic into Crystal's spear.

It was a perfect chance, Jonol was distracted and you would have a full powered strike to take him down with your magic lance. It wouldn't miss, Jonol practically gave his back to you. But should you do it? There was something very unusual that was threatening Crystal's (and Alfoz's) life right now, and you were not sure you could handle it well by yourself, even if Crystal help you later. Should you offer a peace treaty to Jonol and together help your respective comrades?
152112211.title: Here Comes a New Challanger!

1521122111.content:
Not wasting the golden opportunity, you readied yourself and attacked Jonol, throwing away your hesitation. He turned back when he realized what you were doing, but it was too late. Your quick thrust coupled with white magic easily penetrates Jonol's leather vest, piercing his chest onto his back. You didn't hit his heart, but that was sure a fatal attack. You immediately retracted the spear out of him.

"You... b*tch..."

With that, he dropped to the ground, clutching the hole on his chest. He would be dead soon if you didn't help him, but you didn't really care. He tried to kill (and possibly rape) you earlier, so your action was somewhat justifiable, at least to you. What important now was to go where Crystal was. You quickly ran towards where you thought she was, once again tried to channel magic into the spear. You were in luck as the spear soon glowed from magic.

"Uaaaaah!!!"

That was Alfoz again. Seemed like he met his demise. It was both relieving and frustrating that you hadn't heard any voice from Crystal, which could mean she either already dead long ago or she managed to run to safety. Either way, you would be in real trouble soon. Jonol was a decent guy in terms of fighting, and you expected Alfoz to be about the same. If he could be taken down in less than 2 minutes, then you most likely would meet the same fate soon. You never feared death before as you always knew deep down, that no matter what kind of deadly training that your teacher set up for you, even if it would left you half dead, you wouldn't die, because he would be there at the last moment to save your life. But now you were alone, if you didn't count Crystal, your teacher wouldn't be there to save your ass. Heck, this was real, not a training, and death was a huge probability.

You stopped. All these thoughts scared you, for real. Running away crossed your mind as you contemplated. Not once or twice, but several times. Other thoughts said you should gave up, which basically the same thing. But one tiny voice said you should still go to try and save Crystal. Not only because you would be saving your own body, but also because you care about her. Yes, you actually care about her now, not only because that stupid code of conduct your guild set up when you first met her. You might fail, that tiny voice said, but you would regret it forever if you didn't try.

Surprisingly enough, that one tiny voice prevailed. You were not a coward in the first place, anyway. Toughening your determination once more, you started running again.

"Crystal!" you shouted.

As you arrived at the source of the commotion, you saw Crystal sitting down under a tree, head hanged down, clutching her legs in a sitting fetal position. Several trees nearby were broken by something that appeared to be a huge paw or claw, the logs laying down on the forest floor. You saw a small pool of blood, which you though might be Alfoz's, but you saw him nowhere. You thought you might see at least... parts of him, but you saw nothing of sort. And most importantly, there was no sign of the thing that did all this. You quickly strode towards Crystal. Looking at her up close, she appeared to have no wounds, but was visibly shaking. You also heard faint sobbing.

"Crystal?" you softly called her name while lightly put your hand on her shoulder. She jolted, but made no further reaction.

"Crystal, what happened?" you asked again, even softer this time.

Crystal slowly lifted her head. Damn, your old face looked terrible with tears running down on it. You felt uncomfortable looking at it, but tried to hide your feeling.

"I... He... Alfoz... Att-attack... And... And then... And then..."

It was no use asking her now, she was too shocked. She would only produce unintelligible explanation. You made a gesture to make her quit trying and helped her up. She was very weak as she let almost her entire weight on you. Your old body was quite heavy, relative to your current strength, but you managed to drag Crystal down until you reached the village, and sequentially the inn. You let her entered her room, where she plopped down on her bed and resuming the fetal position, laying down sideways and covered in blanket this time. You quietly closed the door and went to the tavern downstairs.

Sitting down in front of the counter, you leaned Crystal's spear beside you. The tavern was empty save the barkeeper, since it was past lunch time already. When the barkeeper saw you, he looked startled, eyes darting between you and the spear. Looking down, you had just realized that some of Jonol's blood tainted your white dress red, and even more was still on the spear. His reaction was understandable. But you didn't care about that at the moment.

"Give me something strong, please..."

He hesitated, but quickly obliged to your request as you stared at him. You had never seen Crystal drunk any type of liquor before, except maybe ale, but you badly need it to calm yourself down. Otherwise you feel like you would break down and cry yourself out like Crystal upstairs. The barkeeper put down a small bottle of something and a smaller glass. You waste no time pouring down some of it and chugged it down your throat. The sensation felt very strong in your new body, but that was exactly what you were looking for.

Your plans had ended up in failures so far. First, your idea of using respective weapon didn't work, which made you had to try the alternative. It was also your idea to find help to catch the monster that did the swap, which ended terribly. Also, that wasn't your idea, but whatever attacked Crystal and Alvoz still haunted your mind. These couple of days had been nothing but bad luck. After a while, you noticed someone entered the tavern, but paid no attention to it, until that person walked up right beside you, and swung his weapon. You barely managed to grabbed your spear and jumped away before your skull was crushed.

It was quite a surprise to see Jonol there, but even more surprising was the fact that his wound didn't appear to be treated at all. Fresh blood still smeared his chest, no doubt coming from the hole in it. His breath was erratic, expression stuck in wrath mode, with blank eyes starring straight at you. If you had to describe it shortly, he looked like a revengeful zombie.

"I WILL KILL YOU!"

At least you couldn't be wrong on the revengeful part. But despite how he looked like, he seemed full of vigor, ready to act his revenge. Just another bad luck for you.

The barkeeper could only watch helplessly as his tavern was slowly destroyed in a game of deadly tag, Jonol smashed anything that stood between you and him as you were trying to keep your distance. Soon you had no choice but to confront him, once again tried to channel your magic. As one of his attack missed, you thrust the magic imbued spear on his chest again, this time right on his heart. It was a bullseye, but something strange happened. First, there was a sizzling sound coming from his newly made wound, as if it was burned. That didn't happen with your previous attack in the forest. Secondly, even after his heart was pierced and you retracted the spear, he was still moving. And the last one was that he appeared to feel nothing.

"Oh my... You are really..."

Your teacher ever taught you not to deal with the undead, because they were too difficult to be taken care of by normal fighters such as you and him. It would need magic to deal with them properly, preferably holy or fire element. His wizard friend ever showed you what happened when one use holy and fire magic to an undead: they burned easily. Crystal's magic was not something that she could be proud of, more less coming from the inexperienced you, but it was a holy magic nevertheless. That burning reaction that you produced meant that Jonol was no longer among the living.

"Alright, that's enough..."

You heard a voice as Jonol, whom were having the same expression this entire time, showed a pained face. He was grunting as some kind of black... energy ball, or whatever that was, slowly exiting his chest. Having no clue to what you just saw, you could only silently stared at the now static and lifeless Jonol lying on the floor, as the ball completely out of him. It hovered there for a moment, before flying toward the one who spoke earlier.

"So you have, if not almost inexistent, holy magic, I see... Quite interesting..." the person said as the black ball swirling around it's hand.

It was...
1521122111.title: Attack Jonol

15211221112.content:
The woman holding the black swirling ball of energy lowered her hand letting the ball swirl around her from side to side as if to demonstrate just how much control she had over her magic. Grinning she let the ball of energy dissipate and walked towards you slowly. You readied your weapon, preparing yourself for another fight when all of a sudden the woman disappeared from your vision. You nervously spun around expecting her to pop out from behind you only that wasn't the case at all. She was still completely out of your sight. You nervously turned back forward and were shocked to not see her there either. Wait..., you quickly glanced up at the ceiling, but still she seemed to be missing. Strange..., just where was sh-

"Boo!" Shouted the woman's voice from behind as she grabbed you. You squealed at her touch and dropped your weapon by mistake. You struggled to try and escape her grip, but the woman held on firmly if only barely. Eventually she let go, an action which almost made you clumsily fall on the floor. Catching your footing at the last moment you picked up your spear and turned around. "Who are you, just what do you want?" The lady looked at you for a moment, smirking to herself. "How would you like to learn how to fully make use of your magic?"

You eyed the woman for a moment. Could you really trust her? From what you saw it was true she seemed very capable in the magic arts, but why would she want to help you? What was her reasoning? Also Crystal herself was currently teaching you anyways. Why would you need another teacher at all? She doesn't even use the same magic type for crying out loud. And yet you found yourself intrigued, Maybe this woman really knew what she was talking about. Maybe she just felt like you, err Crystal, had more potential. You thought about all of this for a moment, thinking really hard about the situation.
15211221112.title: A woman

choices: Don't tell her, maybe trick her into believing her own story
152112211121.content:
Your grip tightened at the spear on your hand while starring at the woman's smug face.

"No..." you said firmly to her.

While it was true you would need to understand your (Crystal's) power more, it was a bad idea to blindly accept this woman's proposal. But then again, you're kind of in a very bad condition right now, so a little help would be very appreciated.

The woman began to frown from your refusal, so you quickly added, "...unless you tell me what's in it for you"

Her frown once again changed into a smile, beamed it's beauty towards you. She looked older than you or crystal, but not that much. In normal circumstances, you would be, at the very least, interested to know such a beautiful woman better, if not outright fell in love with her. But you were in a condition that you sure nobody would say normal; your body swapped with a girl and was attacked by a zombie controlled by this woman, among other things. Besides, it was just your gut feeling, but you feel bad things might happen to you if you follow this woman. But maybe that was because two guys just betray you earlier, anyway.

"What's in it for me? Nothing! I just love to see another magic user like me around. I'm not saying we are rare, but I do rarely meet one these days," she said, still smiling, "it will be a pleasure for me to have another proficient magic user around as a friend"

Her reasoning makes sense. Magic users rarely interact with each others, unless they were banded together in a mage guild. Most prefer to hide or secluded themselves, secretly doing unthinkable experiments or simply didn't like the attention. This is because common folks either fear or outright hate magicians. Except healers, folks love healer.

But that didn't 100% mean she told the truth.

"...I don't believe you"

She pouted. Literally. And she looked cute as hell.

"Why not? And here I thought I find a guy with great power but not quite grasp his power yet as my companion. I can help you easily tap this girl's power, you know... Teaching you would be my pleasure..."

More sweet talks from her... If she thought it would be easy to convince you, she was gravely mistaken. But before you could speak up your mind, you realized that she said something odd, and unconsciously muttered it out loud.

"Wait... 'A guy with great power'?"

"Well yeah, I mean, you know the technique to steal this girl's body, so I believe you have talent for magic," she said, emphasizing on the word 'steal.'

'Steal' she said. It confused you a lot that it was shown on Crystal's face, which was mimicked by the woman. Both of you were in bewildered state until finally you get what she was taking about. This woman knew that you were not the rightful owner of Crystal's body and she assumed that you stole it from Crystal. Disregarding her mistake, it would mean that she was able to see through your body and looked into your soul, or whatever there was, and determine that you did not belong in here.

Before you started to say anything, however...

"If you two can just leave me here alone to cry over my destroyed chairs and tables and possibly bury a dead body later, that'd be great..." the inn keeper suddenly said, breaking the silence.

The woman seemed surprised at the inn keeper's remark, but then walked towards him. Smiling, she took something out of her black robe and put it on the counter. It was a small sack.

"Sooorry for your trouble, here is something to make up for it," she cooed.

You assumed the sack contained some gold, and you were right as you saw the inn keeper's eyes lit up as he opened it. Nevertheless, the woman backed away and returned her attention back towards you.

"Now, where were we?"

This woman obviously knew at least a thing or two about souls. She might be able to help you and Crystal with your body swapping problem. But should you trust her? Obviously she had interest in you based on a false assumption. Would she still be friendly and cooperative once you tell her the truth?

Gritting your teeth, you finally decided to...
152112211121.title: Don't trust her yet

1521122111211.content:
You decide that your best option was to tell her the truth. Sure you didn't know if you could trust her, but maybe she herself knew the spell for switching bodies. It was definitely worth a shot if it meant being able to switch back with yourself. "Follow me." You told her as you headed towards your inn room. She followed you closely, casually humming to herself. Her voice was actually pretty beautiful you had to admit. Entering the room you closed the door and locked it.

"You're probably wondering why I brought you here, right?" You ask, only surprisingly she steps even closer to you.

"It's because you want my body right?" She asks, placing a hand on her hip.

"Huh?"

"Well I'm sure you'll find you won't be able to. My magic is way stronger than yours, and I already put up a defense against you. Go ahead and try."

"Uh..."

"See you can't do it right?" She asked.

"No, no that's not what I was going to talk to you about." The intelligent impression you got from her earlier seemed a bit off base now. She was kind of ditzy.

Brushing her hair back she looked at you grinning. "Oh, you're not going to trick me into lowering my guard, now try to switch with me already."

"Look, just listen to me for one second okay. I didn't switch with this girl on purpose. We were both on a mission for some weird blue elk-like creature that was eating some vegetables. When we cornered it though, it shot us with a beam and swapped our bodies. You're the only one I can turn to on this, do you know how to change us back?"

The girl stared at you her eyes widening as she realized the situation you were in. "Nope I don't remember the spell for it. I've only heard about it once and I'm kind of forgetful."

Well that was no help at all was it? You thought to yourself. You sighed, but still wondered if she knew about the creature you were describing. Asking the girl she responded with...
1521122111211.title: Tell her the truth

choices: "Okay, fine... But I got my eyes on you..."
"I am sorry, but I can't trust you yet..."
15211221112112.content:
"Oh?!" You lit up.

If this woman was willing to cooperate, then it would at least make things a little less confusing and stressful to you and Crystal. Something like, how to reverse the swap or at least how to deal with the after effect of the swap. In other word, gaining each other's skill. You just wish that the swap was really reversible.

"What did you know?" you asked her.

Putting on a smug face she answered, "I know that the creature is very rare, almost like a mythical creature. If it got cornered, it will swap its opponent's soul around. It will cause confusion and helplessness, because they are unfamiliar with the body and can't use each other skills"

There was a tinge of pride in her voice. Nevertheless, you already knew what she was just saying based on experience.

"Unfortunately, I already know that... Any other info about that creature? Like, how to reverse the swap?"

Her smug expression changed into a sheepish smile, "I don't know about that..."

"Well, how about ways to temporary counter the spell?" you asked again.

"I don't know that either..."

"...Maybe its name?"

"Ehehe..."

"Don't you 'ehehe' me!" you snapped from the stress.

The woman flinched from your shout. She looked like she wanted to retaliate, but stopped when she saw tears streaming down your face. Realizing this, you quickly wiped the tears with Crystal's sleeve. It had been ages since the last time you were crying. Maybe it was a girl thing or whatever, but you found that you were unable to stop crying.

"Ugh, stop crying, damn it!"

You cursed at yourself. You hate crying because it reminded you of your past, of your weak past, before the guild took you in. Suddenly, the woman walked toward you and hugged you, your head resting sideways at the huge mounds on her chest.

You were surprised at this gesture and almost immediately wanted to break out, but then you hear the woman say, "there there... It is okay to cry sometimes when you feel sad, it is nothing to be ashamed of," while softly stroking your hair.

You didn't know what happened, but you found yourself unable to hold your tears anymore and started to cry out loud. The woman stayed silent and listened to your wailing. A few minutes later, it turned into soft sobs, and the woman finally let go of you. When you wanted to wiped your tears (and mucus) with your sleeve again, she stopped you, reached into her robe, and took out a handkerchief. You gratefully took it from her hand.

"I'm sorry that I can't help much. I read about the creature on the same book I read about that body stealing spell, which apparently is based on that creature's power. That was a really quick read, and it was a book full of weird spells, so I can't remember much of it. I am very sorry..."

The woman said it with a guilty expression. You felt bad making this woman felt responsible for it.

"No, it is okay... Sorry I yelled at you earlier, err..." you just realized you hadn't known her name yet.

The woman smiled at you, "My name is Selina. I haven't know your name yet, either"

"I am Jack... But this body belongs to my friend Crystal," you smiled back at her.

"So is this Crystal still with you?" Selina asked, seemed excited.

"Uhh, yeah, she is in another room. Why?"

"You see, I knew we didn't start our meeting in a proper manner, I attack you and whatnot, and I said I was looking for a fellow magician as a companion, but honestly, I feel very lonely. You don't seem like a bad guy, and I expect Crystal to be the same, so can I join you two? Besides, I am interested in this whole body swapping ordeal. I would like to see it is resolved"

You thought for a moment, "you say I don't seem like a bad guy, but you are sure like one Selina, with your black magic and your clothing," you said, pointing at her dark robes and tunic.

"Hey, don't be a classist! Dark magic doesn't automatically mean it is bad! It is how you use the magic! Even holy magic can be used for bad things! And don't you dare critique my clothing taste!"

It was her turn to snap at you. It looked like she was sensitive in this matter. Well, about the clothes, you like dark colors too, so you didn't have the right to speak on that.

"Okay, okay, I am sorry... I was just betrayed by two mercenaries today, one of whom you used to attack me, okay? So pardon my suspicion"

"Ooh, I see... So he was your comrade? I just saw you stabbed him and then ran away from afar by accident in the forest, so I wanted to play with you," she grinned mischievously.

"*sigh* Please refrain from doing such dangerous game in the future..."
