"No problem! So, am I in?"
15211221112112.title: "I have heard of it actually."

choices: Try to coax Crystal into joining you.
Don't push her any further, Crystal may need some time alone.
152112211121121.content:
You sigh for a moment and ultimately decide to let her join you, so long as you can keep an eye on her.

Selina’s expression turned into a half smile. On the one hand she seemed glad that she was able to join you, but on the other hand she was also a bit saddened that you didn’t trust her. You knew you couldn't help it though, after all you had just met her and she did just set an undead brute on you. Even if she didn't actually want to kill you, it wasn't exactly a funny joke by any means, but nevertheless, now was not the time to think about that. Right now you needed to focus on finding that creature again. Just then your stomach growled, which caused Selina to giggle slightly.

"Hungry are we?" She asked bemused.

"A little..." You sheepishly replied as your stomach continued to groan.

"hehe, well then, why don't we go fix that huh? It'll be my treat."

You nodded in agreement and as you were about to leave the inn you remembered all about Crystal. "Hold on, let me go and get Crystal first as well. I think she should meet you after all."

Selina grin grew a bit wide at this. "So is she the one that's in your body?"

You nodded. "Yes she is, hold on just a second while I fetch her."

You quickly ran off towards Crystal's room and knocked on her door. A few moments later Crystal finally opened the door. She was shaking slightly and she seemed to force a smile at your presence. You figured she was just shaken up from all that had happened earlier. Losing her body and getting attacked must have stressed her out quite a bit. Perhaps some food and some time away from her room would help cheer her up.

"Say, want to go out and eat? I met a mage who knows about the creature that swapped us, well sort of..." You tell her, hoping she'll join you.

Crystal thinks about it for a moment carefully and shakes her head. "I don't really want too, I mean what if this mage tries to kill us like those last two guys?"

"We just have to be cautious is all, and honestly she doesn't seem like a bad person, and so far she's the only lead we have, so why not?"

Crystal gazed to the side and didn't respond to your question. She seemed hesitant about the whole thing, and while you would like her to join you were reluctant to push the matter any further, as you didn't want to upset her. Still though, this was a great chance, maybe the Selina knew something, anything about the beast, or perhaps she knew someone who did, or perhaps a book on it or something.
152112211121121.title: Crystal's reluctance

choices: Divine Tree - Jeval Forest of Harmony
1521122111211212.content:
For a moment you think about trying to convince Crystal, but looking at her sad expression makes you reconsider. It probably isn't a good idea to force her anymore than necessary right now.

You look up at Crystal staring directly into her own, err, your eyes. "Alright, well I'll be back soon okay?"

Crystal nods at this, but from the way she's acting she seems almost distant. It's actually pretty sad to see her this way, but there's not really much you can do to cheer her up, other than hopefully getting some more information on the creature that swapped you and how to reverse it.

Walking back down the hallway towards Selina she smiles at you. "So, where's this Crystal girl then?"

"She didn't want to come unfortunately." You told her, whilst shrugging your shoulders.

Selina frowned a bit, but quickly regained her composure of happiness and told you to follow her.

And so you did...

You followed her, for what felt like at least half an hour, as you passed by both the nobles district and slums. Eventually you both arrived at a restaurant building which seemed to be average in pretty much every way. From the interior, to the exterior, and even the choices on the menu. Flipping through the various dishes you finally settled on some beef stew. It wasn't the cheapest item on the menu, but it wasn't the most expensive either. Selina on the other hand decided to get a mini pork roast.

You had a while before the food would be ready, so this gave both you and Selina some time to discuss things.

"So, is there anyone who would know about this creature, or do you know where the book you read about the creature is?" You asked her, filled with hope that she may know something you don't.

Selina looked to the side for a moment, and placing her index finger on her cheek thought for a second. She then glanced back over to you and winked. "I don't know anyone else who would know about the creature, but I do know where the book is."

You couldn't help but smile at this piece of information. Grinning widely you slammed your hands down on the table and leaning forward raising your voice a little. "Where is it?"

"ehehe, while you're a girl you shouldn't lean forward to much, otherwise those guys over there..." She pointed behind her towards a few guys who seemed to be staring at your chest.

You awkwardly sat back down but couldn't help try to pressure more information out of her. "So, is it near or far, or?"

Selina winked at you. "It will take about a month to travel there by caravan. So it's far, but not that far."

Your heart sunk a little at this, but really in the grand scheme of things a month wasn't so bad right? "So is it located in a city then, or?"

Selina looked around for a moment cautiously, her eyes scanning the room before leaning in slightly and whispering to you. "It's located at..."
1521122111211212.title: Don't push her any further, Crystal may nee...

choices: Crystal agreed to help, but proposed to catch the creature
15211221112112122.content:
"What? But that's outside Mallow Kingdom!"

"Of course it was, silly. I just said that it is a month by caravan, do you think Mallow kingdom is that big?"

"...that's true"

Although it is one of the biggest Kingdom in the land, it would probably only take a couple of weeks by caravan to go from one side of the border to the other. You've never been outside the Kingdom, as you heard there were many dangers outside the border where no one governs the land. Besides, you just started your adventure less than a month ago. But there was another thing on your mind.

"Well, going out of the border is one thing, but if I heard right, that place is ruled by elves? A particular race of elf who shunned human? How can we get in there?"

"That's okay, I am permitted to enter. They allow magicians such as me to enter," Selina said while puffing her chest in a proud gesture.

"Good for you, but what about me and Crystal? We are not magician... Are you allowed to bring non-magician visitors?"

Realization hit her, and Selina smiled sheepishly at you. You sighed at her constant ditzy-ness.

"Whatever, it is almost too much of a problem to get there..." you leaned back on your chair, then started muttering to yourself, "maybe I need to go back to initial idea, catching that creature..."

While you were musing by yourself, the food arrived. It looked like Selina weren't going to wait to devour her pork roast, so you grabbed a spoon and started eating yourself. The stew taste much better than you expected. You wonder if this place was Selina's favorite.

"I've been in this town several times, and I always come here each time," Selina said, as if she could read your mind, "it was pure luck that I found this restaurant on my first visit to the town. I wonder why this restaurant isn't very popular"

You know what Selina meant. Despite the average but comfy & spacious room this restaurant had, only several people were inside. And it was already time for lunch too, so it should have been packed with guests.

"Maybe because it is too deep inside the town? I mean, I might get lost if I try to find my way out of here to the inn by myself..." you said in between your chewing.

"Probably..." Selina said without looking at you. She was devouring her meal real fast.

"Hungry, aren't you?" you asked while smiling.

"Hungry is an understatement, I'm starving. I've just arrived in town, you know, when I followed you back from the forest. I haven't eaten anything since yesterday," she said, while waving to the waiter, "I want to order a second, do you want to?"

"No, I don't need one... I want a cold drink instead"

Once Selina finished ordering another pork roast and two glasses of ice tea, you asked her again, "by the way, you haven't tell me why you come in this town now. Just passing through?"

"Oh actually, I'm in a mission to try and subdue a beast that supposedly live around the forest near this town. I saw it once, from afar and while hiding so it didn't see me. I was afraid, you know. It looked menacing. But when I told my guild about this, they told me to get it by myself for THEM! Those merciless ancient hags..."

"You are in a guild?"

"Well, you can't really call it a guild actually... More like a coven. We worked separately, despite being in the same faction"

"Wait a second, if I agreed to your proposal to become your friend back when you asked me in the inn before I told you my predicament, would you bring me along to hunt this beast?"

Listening to your question, Selina smiled sinisterly, a smile you never saw her made before. It sent chills to your spine.

"Maybe," she said flatly.

"...Well, what about now? Are you still asking for my cooperation?"

"Now that you know about it, I will ask you to help me willingly. I wasn't going to ask you, because in your current state you wouldn't be able to help much anyway, am I right? But if you are willing to help me, I'll try to find any way to get that book I mentioned for you. What do you say?" Selina said, still with the smile from earlier.

"*sigh* I just know there is no way you would help us for free. I hate to say this, but you are our only visible hope right now, so I will help you. But I will have to ask Crystal first. She and I just recovered from our first episode of betrayal, after all. You might betray us too, as far as I know"

"Maybe"

Your eyes grew wide at her flat remark. Selina then laughed and said it was a joke, but you couldn't get her cunning smile out of your mind for the rest of your meal.

Just after you finished your stew, a waitress who brought another pork roast and ice tea came to your table. Suddenly, your thought drifted into Crystal back at the inn and you remembered two things at once. The first one was...

"Excuse me, can we take out an order?" you asked the waitress.

"Sure, you want these to be wrapped?"

"Oh, no... I want to order chicken soup for take out"

"No problem, it will be ready when you finished," the waitress smiled at you before leaving.

"Are you still hungry?" Selina asked.

"No, it's for Crystal..." then you went on to the second thing you remembered, "by the way, did you hear the loud roar when you saw me back at the forest this morning?"

"Umm... Yes? I heard something, but it wasn't really clear. When I head to the direction it came from, I saw you and that guy you stabbed. What was it?"

"Well, you see, I don't know either... By the time I get there, it was gone and only Crystal remained. I think she saw something horrible. That's why she is in quite unstable condition right now. I'm starting to think, she saw the one you seek"

"Ooh, that might be possible! I will just have to ask her later," Selina said with gleaming eyes before she started devouring her second serving.

You quietly sipped at your ice tea. Things were getting more complicated now. You doubt Crystal would willingly cooperate with Selina, not today. Besides, you yourself still felt something wasn't right about Selina, like she still hid something from you. But there was no use worrying about that now. You finished your tea just before Selina finished her meal and drink. Selina paid for her and your meal as she promised, but you insisted to pay for the soup. Then both of you started to walk back to the inn.


*****


You knocked at Crystal's room. There was no answer, so you knocked harder. You heard some mumbles from inside. A moment after, the door opened and Crystal emerged. Looked like you just woke her up from her sleep. She looked better than last time, though.

"Hey, sorry I disturb your sleep. Feeling better already?" you asked softly.

"That's okay... I'm better somewhat, I guess," she answered with a weak smile.

"That's good to hear... Say, are you hungry?" as Crystal nodded, you added, "well then, come downstairs. I bought soup for you. I asked the inn keeper to heat it up"

"...Will the person you mentioned earlier be there?"

"Err...Yes... She want to talk to you in person"

"*sigh* I guess it can't be helped... Let's go"

Downstairs, Selina was waiting on a table. There was a bowl of soup in front of her, and she was watching it intently that she didn't realized you were back. Approaching the table, you decided to tease her.

"Hey, you already ate two servings earlier"

"Oh? N-no, I don't want that... I just, uhh... Guarding it from flies, yeah..." Selina said while blushing.

Meanwhile, Crystal finally saw Selina for the first time. You could tell that Crystal was suspicious of her, but Selina's reaction to your tease should ease it up a bit. You just hope from the bottom of your heart that Selina was not a bad person and would not betray the two of you. Because if she did, then not only Crystal, but also you would become untrustful to people afterward, if you survive the betrayal.

Selina finally acknowledged Crystal and smiled at her, "hello, you must be Crystal. My name is Selina"

"...Nice to meet you," Crystal said very softly, almost as a whisper.

You almost forgot that Crystal was very timid around new people. You gestured for her to sit down. Crystal sat down, and you brought the bowl of soup closer to her. The nice aroma made Crystal's mouth wet, and she quickly started to eat. You just leaned on your chair waiting for her to finish. Glancing on Selina, she was watching Crystal. But it looked like her mind was not on the soup this time. As you were wondering what she was thinking about, Selina spoke.

"You know Jack? You never mentioned that you are this handsome," she said while smiling playfully.

Your eyes widen and Crystal froze mid-chewing from the remark.

"Wh-what are you saying so suddenly?" you said, embarrassed.

"Hehe, sorry if I surprised you. But it is true, though..."

Crystal resumed her eating as you mumbled to yourself. But Selina wasn't finish just yet.

"Then again, Crystal is also beautiful. You two make a great couple"

This time you almost didn't have time to react since Crystal was choking on her food. You quickly got up and asked for water from the keeper. You gave the glass to Crystal who quickly gulped it down.

"We are not a couple..." you finally said to Selina.

"Oh really? I thought you are for sure..." she grinned at you.

You started to think this is payback for your tease earlier.

"Anyway, sorry if this bring back bad memory, but here is the deal," you started to explain to Crstal.
15211221112112122.title: Finally met

152112211121121221.content:
After you finished explaining things to Crystal, everything became quiet. Crystal looked off to the side a bit shyly, mulling it all over. "I think..." She paused for a moment.

"I think we should go through with it. Catching the creature hasn't gone all that well, and I think this is probably our best chance to get back to normal. Though, uh, if we see the beast along the way I still think we should chase it. Is that alright with you, Selma?" Crystal asked, not really knowing what to expect.

"My name is Selina, and sure that's fine, though I'd still like you both to accompany me on the original task if you do swap back though."

"Oh sorry..." Crystal said apologetically.

"It's fine, I have trouble with names too now and again." Selina said, chuckling to herself. "Anyways, we don't have to go on this mission right away. Let's leave tomorrow afternoon or something."

You all agreed to her plans, and decided to prepare for the next day ahead by visiting the store. Crystal decided to come along with you this time, but Selina went off to who knows where. It was a bit suspicious, but you didn't really think much of it. She probably needed some other materials or items seeing as she was a dark mage. Whatever the case, you didn't let it concern you very much. It wasn't really your business at what she decided to buy. After a few hours of gathering up both food, backpacks, rope, bedrolls, and two tents you were now almost out of money. As you were leaving the shopping district, Crystal grabbed your arm.

"There's a channeling gem on sale.You should buy it and socket it onto my spear so you can channel magic better. These usually don't come cheap. You really should consider it."

You walked over towards the stand to better look at the gem. It was a deep shade of blue, and while parts of the surface were scratched, it was still in decent condition. You then glanced up towards the price to find out you wouldn't even have enough money for another night at the inn if you bought it. You'd probably have to camp outside, or room with Selina, wherever she was staying at least. You considered the thought for a moment, before grabbing your spear and letting some of your magic flow into the weapon. The spear started to glow slightly before fizzling out. You definitely needed more practice, that's for sure.

"So how does this gem work exactly?" You asked.

"It just helps you draw out your magic, simple as that. However, after a while the gem won't be needed, and even using it will just hold your power back. You'll need to get a stronger one once you become skilled enough, or you could just train normally. Either way though, it does help bring out your potential a little bit." Crystal explained.

You mulled it over for a second before finally deciding to...
152112211121121221.title: Crystal agreed to the proposal

1521122111211212211.content:
"Excuse me, I'd like to buy this..."

You'd need all help you could get to succeed. If this gem could help you, even if it meant became penniless, so be it. Crystal instructed you on how to properly socket the gem to her spear. Once done, you tried channeling your power into the spear. It worked, the gem forcefully brought out the mana kept hidden inside you. The spear shined, ready to strike. You noted that you couldn't increase or decrease the amount of mana you channel to it, you could only stop it. It must be the gem's power. The stronger the gem, the more mana it absorbed per second.

"Well, is that too strong for you?" Crystal asked 3 minutes after you started activating the gem.

Since you were not feeling tired at all, you assumed you still had a lot of mana left.

"No, I think this is just right..."

"Very well... Just remember not to activate it all the time during battles. Otherwise, you would run out of mana and stamina fast. I think you should keep channeling for now, to see your limit"

"Got it... Umm, Crystal, we have a problem. I, uhh, spent the rest of our money on this gem"

"I know that... But that is a sacrifice I'm willing to take, that's why I ask you to consider buying it. Let's find a place to set up a camp," Crystal started walking.

"Shouldn't we wait for Selina?"

Crystal stopped and turned back, "Why?"

"So we can ask to stay with her?" you don't know why, but you suddenly regret saying that.

"Oh, okay... You can do that... I'll set up a camp myself"

"Why don't you ask her too? I'm sure she won't mind..."

"Probably... But I don't want to be in too much debt to her"

"That's true..." you muttered.

"Aww, you don't need to worry about such thing!"

Selina showed up between you out of thin air while saying that. You and Crystal both screamed at her sudden appearance, drawing the market's attention to the three of you.

"You two are welcomed to stay with me anytime!" she seemed unfazed by your and Crystal's scream, she must had get used to people being surprised at her.

"S-since when are you..." you asked, though not quite finished.

"Since Crystal asked you to buy that channeling gem," she answered nonchalantly.

"Thank you for your offer, but I don't need it. I will camp outside for tonight," crystal still stubbornly refuse it.

"Really? Are you sure?" Selina said while smiling at Crystal.

"Yes. See you tomorrow. If you want, you can invite Jack," Crystal said while starting to walk away.

"Okay then, see you!" Selina waved at her, "So, wanna come Jack?"

You felt conflicted. On one side, you felt bad if you left Crystal sleeping outside by herself. On the other side, refusing Selina's offer might hurt her feeling, which in turn might worsen your partnership. But you need to make a choice who to sleep with.

...Somehow, that didn't sound right.
1521122111211212211.title: Buy it

choices: Crystal was right. Selina can't be trusted. Just eat your rations instead.
Crystal was wrong. Selina was too nice to be untrustworthy. She wanted to help.
15211221112112122111.content:
You hesitated for a moment before realizing it was probably a better idea to pitch a tent and sleep with crystal outside for the night rather than staying with Selina. It wasn't exactly that you didn't trust Selina, but something seemed a bit off about her. Not that that was necessarily something negative, but you figured she might just ask you about things you weren't comfortable with telling a stranger. Not only that, but it probably would be a good idea to keep a close eye on Crystal since she was in your body. The last thing you needed was for something bad to happen to your own body that could have been avoided if you were there.

You turned towards Crystal and shouted "Hold on just a moment."

You looked back at Selina and frowned a bit. "Sorry, but I need to keep an eye on my body in case something happens, I hope you understand."

Selina just smiled happily at you in response. "Oh I understand, it's no problem at all. Though if you change your mind or need something, don't hesitate to come find me." Selina says with a wink.

"Thank you, I'll keep that in mind." You smile at her briefly before running back towards Crystal. "Alright I'm ready then, let's go camp by the edge of the town or something."

Crystal nodded. "That's not to bad of an idea, let's go then."

You both headed off to the edge of the town near the forest and while you set up the tent Crystal was out picking up some wood for a small campfire. It wasn't long before night rolled around. Both you and Crystal had helped set up the campfire and had idly chatted about your current situation, as well as discussing plans and tactics on how to best confront the creature that swapped you should one of you find it again. After talking to each other and eating some modest rations you had managed to procure from a local shop. They were actually pretty bland, but given your current money situation it was better than nothing. As sleep time rolled around both you and Crystal entered the tent and hopped in your sleeping bags.

Sleeping on the hard ground was tough enough, but as a girl it seemed almost hopeless. You glanced over to the side to see if Crystal was having just as much trouble as you or not. To your surprise she was sound asleep, so rather than say anything to her you tried to go to sleep one more time. A few minutes into trying to fall asleep you felt something press up against you. Opening your eyes you saw your own body had rolled over next to you along with the whole sleeping bag.

"I...I don't trust her. Selina is no good." Your body muttered.

You froze in place for a moment taking this all in as you started to question Selina's intentions and whether Crystal was right or not. A few hours later of careful debate you finally fell asleep from exhaustion.

Waking up in the morning you felt kind of tired as if you had not nearly obtained enough rest. Which honestly seemed about right considering everything that had happened last night. You sat up and rubbed your groggy eyes to see that Crystal was still asleep. You figured it was best not to wake her up for now at least.

"Good morning everyone!" You heard a cheerful voice from outside, one that could only belong to Selina. "I brought breakfast."

Crystal woke up due to the racket and sighed. "She's very persistent, can't she take a hint? How'd she even find us out here anyways? I swear she must be stalking us or something." Crystal said as she slowly got out of bed, a look of annoyance on her face

You slowly stood up and groggily walked over to the exit of the tent as the smell of fresh eggs and meat wafted into your nose.

Before you could step outside though, Crystal grabbed your arm. "Are you really going to eat her food?"

After all the thinking you had done last night you felt that...
15211221112112122111.title: Camping with Crystal.

choices: You arrived at the site without problem
You couldn't find it as you got a little lost
152112211121121221112.content:
Gently grasping Crystal's hand, you smiled a little at her, saying, "it's alright, Crystal... We should trust her more"

She looked hesitate, so you added, "I am not entirely trusting her either, but if she truly doesn't mean harm to us, she would be saddened by the way we have been treating her, don't you think?"

Crystal finally relented and released her hand from your shoulder.

"Fine, but I'm not eating with you"

"Okay... If anything happens to me after I eat her food, I'll be counting on you"

You had no intention of forcing her to eat Selina's food. After all, she could be right, and the food might be spiked with something. You're not sure that Crystal could do anything on her own against Selina, but it's better to have an insurance. With another glance at her, you walked out of your tent and approached Selina, still busy holding a pan over the campfire. The closer you got, the more your nose attacked by a delicious aroma. Noticing you, Selina raised her head and grinned.

"Morning! Have a seat, it'll be ready in a minute"

"It smells really nice," you complimented.

"Oh, you're overreacting, it's just fried egg and some slices of deer meat. It's not like I make an elaborate meal, not that I can't make one..." Selina grinned, "by the way, where is Crystal? Still asleep?"

"Ah, no... Uhh, she said she has stomachache, so she'll eat later," you lied, not wanting to hurt Selina's feeling.

"What? Is she okay?" Selina looked concerned.

"Yeah, she's fine. Don't worry, she'll get better soon"

"Well, if you say so... I guess it is done... Here you go... Careful, it is still hot"

Taking the plate that Selina held, once again, a strong smell made its way towards your nostrils. You couldn't hold yourself any longer and immediately stab a fork to your meal and put it in your mouth. It tasted a little different, but not in a bad way. Was it true then, that Selina put something weird in the food? Despite thinking like that, your stomach was growling, so you wolved down your breakfast. Your tongue was a little burned from the hot food and as if knowing that, Selina handed a glass of cold water to you once you finished.

"Thanks," you said after sipping some of it.

You looked at her plate and realized that she had only finished half of her meal, but at least she was eating too, so there might not be a poison in it.

"So, how was it?"

"Different... Did you put something in it?"

"Some spices and herbs. Being a wanderer helps discovering best spices and herbs around"

"You did? Didn't see anything like that..." you said, tilting your head.

"I grinded them up... Do you like it, though?"

"Yeah, it taste better than just plain fried"

"Great! You should taste my soup later, I'm very proud of it!" Selina said with a smug face.

"Alright, looking forward to that," you said with a smile, "by the way, when should we start out search?"

"Well... Yesterday, I said it'd be fine if we start in the afternoon, but I prefer if we start as soon as possible... But Crystal is not feeling well, so..."

"I am fine, don't worry about me," Crystal suddenly popped out of the tent.

"Oh, morning! How's your stomach?" Selina beamed at her.

"It's okay now... We should start our search soon"

"Would you like some breakfast? Or, if you prefer, we can buy something for you in town"

Crystal looked at you as if asking for advice, but you just gave "it's up to you" look.

"...I'd love to eat the porridge from yesterday, thank you," she finally said.

"Alright! I'll go buy it, you two can go clean yourselves," Selina rose from her seat.

"Ah, I want to go with you... So I know the place to buy it," Crystal quickly added as Selina raised an eyebrow.

You knew the real reason of why Crystal wanted to tag along, but you kept quiet. As the two of them went to town, you went to a nearby river to wash your body and several of your and Crystal's dirty clothes. You were hanging the wet clothes near the campfire when Crystal and Selina were back. They then decided to go to the river too as you started to pack and clean up the tent and the campsite. The fire helped drying the clothes real fast, it was almost completely dry when you finished packing. Crystal and Selina were back soon after, the former apologized for not helping you to pack up. Half an hour later, the three of you walked to the forest.

Meanwhile, somewhere in the middle of the forest, a giant beast was walking towards a huge tree. This beast, which was more than twice as tall as a man, looked like a hybrid of a wolf and a bear that's capable on moving on either two or four limbs. It's paws were adorned with sharp claws as big as daggers, it's long tail as strong as a whip with a spear tip. Sharp teeth with jaws strong enough to chew metal and eyes that intimidate anything that sees them.

This beast, however, appeared calm as it slowly approached the tree in front of it. It stopped right underneath it and then laid down. Not long after, the tree trunk glowed a little, as a ghostly apparition flew out of it. Slowly regaining shape and form, it turned into a beautiful girl with flowing green hair, dressed in white robes that covers very little of her body. She flew towards the beast and sat on its back. She slowly patted and rubbed the beast's neck, and the beast seemed to enjoy it.

Back to the three adventurers, the three of you finally arrived at the edge of the forest.

"So, Selina... Do you have a plan on how to find this monster you are looking for?" you asked.

"Well... This is going to resurface bad memories, but I think we should go to where Crystal met it yesterday. There I can search for residual energy using my magic, and then we can follow the trail... Is that okay, Crystal?"

Crystal looked tense for a moment, but finally nodded. The three of you finally started your search.
152112211121121221112.title: Start of a Day

1521122111211212211122.content:
An hour had passed as the three of you continued on towards the spot where Crystal first met the beast. Only problem was, you didn't quite remember being this far out. "Are you sure this is the right place Crystal, I could have sworn we should have turned left around fifteen minutes ago. Weren't we closer to the edge of the woods?" You asked, concerned for your wellbeing.

"I...I'm certain we were supposed to turn right instead," said Crystal, though from the tone in her voice she didn't sound too confident.

"Are you sure? I mean I don't want to get lost out here." You said somewhat worried about the situation. Getting lost in the woods wasn’t exactly ideal in any way, and the last thing you wanted to do was starve to death in Crystal’s body.

"Jack has a point. I mean if you don't know where we are we should probably turn back instead for now and try to approach this from a different angle." Selina chimed in as she agreed with you.

Selina's voice only seemed to cause Crystal to become more irritated though, as she pressed onwards at an even quicker pace. "I'm sure!" She muttered through clenched teeth.

Selina frowned and shook her head lightly. "If you say so, then I trust you." Selina replied, though it was obvious that she wasn't happy with how Crystal was acting.

Fifteen more minutes had passed and you still had no idea where you were. Crystal seemed determined to find the spot where she had first encountered the beast, though it was apparent she didn’t exactly know where she was going. The fact that both you and Selina were silent about the whole thing wasn't really helping either. Still though, you had never actually seen Crystal act like this at all, and while you wanted to break the silence, you felt frightened to say anything. Part of you wondered if this was just a new side effect from the magic swap that occurred, or maybe hormones or something. Did Crystal always feel like this? You looked back at the few earlier adventures you had embarked on with her. She always was kind of quiet, and in fact you distinctly remember having to talk to the quest givers alone as Crystal always seemed too shy to really converse with them. Not that you minded or anything, but it was a bit strange. A bead of sweat started to roll down your face. Were you really going to end up completely like Crystal, first physically and then mentally? You nervously glanced over at Selina who stared at you for a moment before smiling calmly.

“Don’t worry so much, something like that won’t cause any changes.” Selina said in an attempt to console you.

You smiled back at her. Was she reading my mind? And wow, when she’s not acting all ditzy and is actually serious, she’s a lot more composed and mature than I take her granted for. She really is a kind helpful person, and honestly you didn’t quite understand why Crystal held a grudge against her. She’s been nice to the both of you the entire time, and there’s no reason for anyone to think she’s evil, other than the necromancer thing, which frankly wasn’t so bad. I mean you’re part of a rogues’ guild, which might not be considered the most noble. It would be kind of hypocritical to call her out on being evil.

“Thank you, I needed that.” You responded as you felt yourself calm down at her words, as your troubles seemed to lessen slightly.

“You’re welcome. Though, is my cooking really so bad that you think it’d cause you digestion problems? Because I worked really hard to become a better chef for the one I love.”

And just like that you weren’t sure what to think anymore. Selina really was kind of crazy, though you couldn’t help but get a little chuckle out of it anyways.

“Don’t laugh. My cooking is not all that funny.” Selina said as she pouted.

“Oh I’m not laughing at your cooking. I’m laughing at something else.”

“Well what is it then? Spit it out.”

You weren’t quite sure how to say ‘I’m laughing at you’ without hurting her feelings, so you instead opted to shift the topic. “Uh, Nevermind about that, I didn’t know there was a guy you liked Selina.”

At the mention of this Selina put both of her hands to her cheeks and embarrassedly shifted around in a cute manner. “Well let’s just say there’s this special someone I like. From the very first time I laid eyes on him I knew he was my fated partner to be. A few years ago I was in a small town surrounded by an angry mob who wanted to kill me. Heavily outnumbered I was bound to die, but like some hero the man of my dreams appeared before the crowd and stopped them from harming me. He risked his life and allowed me to escape by telling them all that I wasn’t responsible for anything, and that there was no concrete evidence. Because of this, he has won my heart, body, and soul, and I will always love him.”

You paused for a moment before clapping. “Wow, he sounds like a really brave guy to stand up to a mob like that. Though if I may ask, why were the townspeople angry at you?”

Selina looked down for a moment before placing her left hand over her breast. “Well basically they accused me of stealing corpses from the local cemetery to create undead minions and practice necromancy. That was one hundred percent true, but I really don’t see what they were so angry about. Dead people don’t really use their bodies after all.” Selina said smiling.

You paused for a moment, struggling to find the right words to say, but the only thing that would escape your lips was a single word. “Wow.”

Selina smiled enthusiastically. “I know, it really is romant-“

“AAHHHHHH!” Suddenly you heard your body scream from up ahead. Both you and Selina ran ahead to find your body shaking. Crystal then pointed to what appeared to be a human skull sitting at the base of a large tree.

You crouched down and stared at the skull for a moment before realizing it was likely very old and not fresh at all. “Don’t worry, it doesn’t look like this skull is fresh or anything. We should be f-“

ROARRRRRR! The booming sound of an animal could be heard from not too far off. All three of you stood silent for a moment before you began to feel the ground rumble as something seemed to be making its way over to you. You quickly pulled out your weapon, only for the rumbling to increase with each moment the beast drew closer.

Was it really a smart idea to try and fight it? You didn't even know what you were fighting. Maybe it would be better to temporarily retreat for now. In a split second you made a decision.
1521122111211212211122.title: Lost in the woods

15211221112112122111221.content:
"Come! Let's hide!" You said, grabbing Crystal's hand and forcefully dragged her.

Fortunately, there was a thick, wide bush nearby, so you circled around and laid flat on the ground behind it. Crystal followed you and laid on your left while Selina, a bit fallen behind, jumped over the bush and took position on your right. She was about to complain about dirtying her dress when you hushed her as the monster was getting closer. It finally arrived at the clearing and it was more terrifying to you than what you imagined based on Selina's description. The thing growled, slowly inching closer with its four strong legs. It didn't seem to see you, so you felt rather relieved. Looking on your left, Crystal looked terrified while on your right Selina marvelled at the sight of the monster. Seeing a polar opposite between you made you smiled wryly. Soon, however, your attention went back to the monster as it stood on two legs and sniffed the air.

Don't tell me it could smell us?! you frantically thought.

You didn't know what to do if it turned out the monster could find where you were through smell, but then you heard a soft whisper of a chant from beside you. Selina was casting a spell quietly, and when she was done, a soft barrier like spell was placed upon the three of you.

"This will keep our smell hidden," Selina whispered, winking at you, "not that I smell or anything, though... Do I?"

You were relieved to find out that Selina could be reliable when you need her the most. The beast sniffed some more before letting out a low growl, seemingly giving up. It lowered itself onto four legs and slowly strode toward the big tree, the one which had the skull from earlier. It then laid down on the ground and closed its eyes. You were contemplating about quietly sneaking away as it sleep, but something peculiar happened. Something flew out from the tree, something transparent, before it gained mass and materialized into a woman. Her finely shaped body was only covered by a thin white robe, making you a bit 'nervous' even from a distance. She has green long hair that flowed gently as she hovered towards the monster. She sat on top of the monster's back. It seemed to acknowledged the woman's presence, but did nothing about it.

Looking at this strange phenomenon in front of you, you couldn't help but to look at your sides to see their opinion. Crystal still showed fear, but now curiosity was mixed in on her expression. Meanwhile, Selina looked even more ecstatic than before. Before you could speak anything to either of them, though, the woman spoke first.

"You three, you can come out now. Don't worry, I'll make sure he won't attack you"

You almost jumped from suprise. Well, if you thought about it, the woman who spoke should already be around (inside the tree) since the start, so it was no wonder she would know that you're there. The scared and happy people on either of your sides were looking at you, waiting for an instruction. Running away would just provoke the beast, so you gave them both a face of resignation before standing up, revealing yourself.

"Here, we surrendered. Please don't attack us," you raised your hands, although it still held Crystal's spear so it wasn't a very convincing surrender.

Crystal and Selina followed you and stood up. The beast now acknowledged the three of you and growled, but the woman put her hand on its head, and it calmed down. With the monster out of the way, the woman motioned you to come closer, which you obliged.

"You said surrender," the woman started to speak again, "but I think you are gravely mistaken as I don't have any intention to attack you"

"Thank you very much," you replied, still nervous being this near to the beast.

Although it wasn't attacking, the beast still eyed all of you with piercing glare. Crystal looked like she would wet herself anytime (which you earnesly hope she wouldn't) while Selina didn't seemed affected by it.

"Are you a forest spirit?" Selina cheerfully asked.

"No, I'm just a ghost of a dead person. I believe you have seen my remains," she said while pointing at the skull.

"But it is obvious you are not mere ghost! You almost feel divine!"

You smiled inwardly. A necromancer like Selina would sure know how the opposite of her look like.

"Who is it?" a reply came from the inside.

There was a pause. But then there was a sound of the door unlocking. Alex charged her energy towards her right hand, preparing for a new spell. The door swung open, the one on the other side could only stare in shock as Alex shot paralysis spell dead on her chest.

"Tie her up, my spell won't last long," Alex told the just arrived Claire and Luna.

All of them were inside the room now. Mary in Luna was securely tied up and her lips shut.

"Alex, you told me you can reverse this," Claire said.

"I did told you that. But right now my mana is too low to do it, it would be dangerous. There is another way though. Luna will have to do it herself, I'll teach her how to do it"

"What, really? Now?" Luna said in disbelief.

"You have no choice, either learn quickly and do it or trapped in that body forever"

Uncertainly, Luna nodded. Alex gave her the pointers and taught her the spell. Alex then prepared the ritual, using the blood exchange to swap the souls, and she cut both Mary and Luna's hands. Claire tied Luna up in a way that she still could hold Mary's hand. After all the preparation was done and Luna memorized the spell, making sure she said it right, Alex told her to do it. The spell worked, Alex saw with his eyes as their soul exchange places.

"It's done…" Alex announced to Claire.

"Great, now we can interrogate her," Claire said as she untied Luna, "who are you working for?" and asked that to Mary.

Mary just stayed silent.

"Do you know a man named William?" this time Alex asked.

Still no answer.

"Answer us before we start torturing you," Claire threatened.

Mary responded to that, "look at my face, I didn't betray my comrades then, and I will not now," implying torture wouldn't work to her.

"...well, then you are useless," Alex said while raising his blade to attack Mary.

Before he could do it, however, Luna stopped him. Surprised, Claire and Alex looked at her in disbelief.

"Why are you stopping Alex, Luna?" Claire asked her.

"I... I saw a new set of memories... I believe it is hers... And, I don't think she is such a bad person, now..."

"When the exchange is reversed, sometimes memory mix can happen, but it will wear out soon," Alex explained to puzzled Claire.

"I saw her difficulties living in this city, how she managed to get friends, among other bad things... I think I understand her feelings..."

"Don't say that! You don't understand me!" Mary bellowed suddenly.

"But she does," Alex said, "she has your memories, after all..."

Mary went silent again.

"...Luna, are you sure she is not a bad person?" Claire spoke.

"She indeed had done bad things, but she didn't do them for fun or without remorse"

"I see... I forgot to ask you, do you know what happened to Sera? I believe she should be in a little girl's body right now..."

"You mean... Oh no... The little girl was found dead this morning... So that was Sera? Poor her..." Luna's face fell.

Claire bit her lips, "I thought as much... Hey, what's your name again?"

"...Mary," she softly answered.

"Mary, you said torture won't work on you, right? Well, how about a bribe? If we let you have Sera's life, will you betray your friends?"

All of them was shocked when they heard Claire's proposal, Claire included. Claire couldn't believe she actually said that either.

"Claire, are you serious?" Luna asked, still shocked.

"I..." Claire hesitated, "I'm not sure either... But if you really think she is not a bad person, it will be better to let her have Sera's life rather than let everyone knows that Sera is dead"

"Claire has a point," Alex joined, "a body without a soul is the same as dead. If your friend's soul is gone, her body will need a replacement for it. A good one, that is..."

The three of them looked at Mary, whom hadn't said anything yet.

"Are you saying..." Mary started to say, "...that if I betray my friends, you'll not only spare me, but give me a new life?"

"Yes," Claire said confidently, "but you'll need to privide us with useful information. So, what do you say?"
15321112222212211111.title: Base Raid

153211122222122111112.content:
Just as Mary wanted to answer, the door handle rattled, shifting all attention of all person inside. Fortunately, the door was locked so it remained closed. Next, there were several knocks on the door.

"Ma... Umm, Luna, open the door please..." came a voice from behind the door.

Alex glanced at Mary. The latter didn't seem to have an intention of calling out to her friend. But to be sure, Alex gestured at Claire to seal Mary's lips while whispered at Luna to answer the call.

"Oh... Wait a minute..." Luna finally said.

"Hurry, I got a good news for us"

Instead of Luna, Alex walked up towards the door. Charging yet another paralysis spell, Alex prepared for an ambush. He then quickly swung the door open, revealing Jack-in-Sera who didn't even have time to be surprised before Alex hit her. Jack soon got the same treatment Mary got earlier, tied up and interrogated.

"So, what is the good news you were saying?"

"Like hell I'm gonna tell you!" Jack spat back at Claire's question.

"Right... So will you be cooperative or not?" Alex asked.

"No!"

"Are you sure?"

"Absolutely! All of you can just go fffff... Mmmmfh!" Jack's speech was cut as Claire shut her lips.

Alex crouched and opened Mary's mouth seal, saying, "your turn, Mary. What about our proposal?"

Mary seemed to ponder for a while, but then nodded.

"Okay... As a token of our good will, we will let you trade body with Sera now"

Ignoring the muffled protest from Jack, Alex and Claire helped Mary prepared for another body switch. Flawlessly done, since Mary already know the process and spell. Alex immediately helped Mary to gain Sera's memories, as well as Jack's during his time in Sera, by placing her hand on Mary's head.

"So... What is it? What is the 'good news' ?" Claire impatiently asked.

Mary just lifted her head, staring directly at Claire, and said, "William has arrived in this town"


*****


Minutes earlier...

As Daniel exited the house after talking with Bud, he saw people still trying to put down the fire at Mayor's house. Daniel smiled secretly, satisfied with his handwork. He looked around for any sign of Jack's presence, but he couldn't see him anywhere. That's when he heard a low growl from behind. He spun around and met a small, cat like creature staring at him. Daniel instantly recognized it as his master's summoned familiar. As the creature slowly strode away, Daniel followed. It led him toward a dark alley, much like the other one where Jack killed two guards earlier. Two figures were present inside, one of them crouching. Before Daniel's eyes could adjust to the darkness, a ball of light emerged, briefly blinding him. Daniel saw William, his smirk illuminated by the ball that hovered just above his head, and Jack who was on all four. The latter seemed busy pleasuring the former using his mouth.
Nearing it's master, the familiar let out another growl, before dissipated into mist. Walking closer himself, Daniel crouched before his master.

"Welcome to this city, master William," he said in Claire's utmost dignified voice.

"Heh, nice manner you got there, Daniel. Your vessel's personality really rubbed on to you, I suppose?" William answered while snickering.

"I believe you'd prefer this kind of treatment from us, your slaves, from now on, master"

"Now you are just trying too hard to flatter me, Daniel... I never mentioned you two as my slave, have I? You are my subordinates, remember that... Though I do prefer you act like this, than being a carefree, rough-talking hoodlums... You should learn from Daniel, Jack"

"Mmmnh... Yes, master William..." Jack replied in between his service.

"What can we do for you, master?" Daniel asked.

"One moment..." William grunted as he blew his load into Jack's mouth, "whew, you got better, Jack... I would like to meet those other two, Bud and Mary. It has been a long time since I met them last..."

"As you wish... Bud is nearby, if you didn't know already, and he has a present for you. Jack, go back and tell Mary to get here"

"*gulp* Alright"
153211122222122111112.title: An Interruption

1532111222221221111121.content:
Daniel led William towards Bud. There were two guards inside the house, but Daniel told them to guard outside. They entered without knocking, catching Bud red handed kissing Vina while groping her chest.

"Mayor, you shouldn't treat your daughter like that"

Bud shrieked from Daniel's remark, quickly moving from one emotion to another: flustered and scared, then get angry when he realized it was Daniel, then shocked to see William.

"W-will..." Bud said in disbelief.

"That's Master William for you," Daniel hissed, attempting to correct Bud, but William stopped him.

"Relax, Daniel. Bud's my dearest friend, aren't we Bud?" William made a gesture to hug him, so Bud got up from the bed and did just that.

"Have you been well, my friend?" William asked.

"My days were better when we were together, Will... I miss you," Bud replied.

"Glad to see you again. I see you have tasted a fraction of power that I now have, thanks to Daniel and Jack," William said after they broke their hug.

"Yes, and for that, I thank you. I was told that you might be interested in this? Please accept this as my token of gratitude," Bud gave him Vina's soul.

"Ooh? Is this... This girl's soul? Excellent. I thank you. But Bud, I know you... I know you want something in return, yes?" William grinned.

"Well, yes... If it is not much trouble, I want you to make this girl wake up and obey me?" Bud said while pointing at Vina.

"I see... That shouldn't be a problem. Her soul will give me a lot more power than what I need to do that"

William opened the glass jar. The soul inside appeared to try to run away, but William caught it with invisible strings from his left hand. Hovering the soul on his palm, he then began to suck it inside him. Slowly, strings of light escaped from the soul and entered William, making it smaller each second. 10 seconds later, the soul was gone completely.

"Ahh..." William sighed, satisfied, "pure soul is the best. And now, for your request"

William now lifted his right hand in front of him. A black ball slowly formed on his palm. Once it was the same size with the soul ball, William casted it towards Vina's souless body. The black ball slowly entered her chest, then disappeared completely.

"I made an artificial soul based on that girl's real soul. She should act almost the same like the original, but now your words are law to her. She will willingly serve and please you anyway you want. Basically, you have a perfect slave now," William said to Bud while smiling sinisterly.

"Oh, thank you very much, Will... Wow, you managed to create an obidient slave in less than 5 minutes, while I need years to create one. And they are not perfect," Bud was honestly impressed.

"Anything for my friend. Now, since you are the mayor of this city, I expect that we can have a great new friendship ahead of us, by profiting each other, am I right?"

"Anything for you too, friend"

Daniel just looked at them silently. He rembered that back when all of them were still together, Bud and William were best friend. He still didn't know whether William's act just now towards Bud was sincere or not, though. Daniel shrugged, it didn't matter as long as all of them get along well.

Vina started to awake just as a knock was heard on the door. Without waiting for a response, the door opened, and Keith entered.

"Claire, my men told me you made them wait outside as you brought in a suspicious individual into Mayor's room. May I ask who you are?" his last question was directed at William.

Bud almost panicked, but Daniel and William remained calm.

"Suspicious individual, they say?" Daniel said, "Keith, you should teach your men not to have prejudice towards everyone. This man here is a healer that I know very well. He happened to be in this city so I asked his help to check on Mayor's daughter because he was concerned of her condition"

"Father? Where am I?" suddenly Vina asked.

Bud looked surprised at first, but quickly assumed his new identity, "you are in a friend's house. Our house is burned down. But don't worry Vina, you are safe now"

"Oh father, I'm glad that you are okay," Vina said while hugging Bud.

"As you can see, he managed to wake her up," Daniel added, "I think you owe him an apology"

"Ah, yes... I'm sorry for my and my men's rudeness, mr..."

"William," he continued, extending his right hand to shake Keith's, "and you are?"

"Keith Rayleigh, captain of the guards here at Falion city. Also Claire's brother, if you haven't known already," Keith accepted William's hand.

As soon as their hands met, Keith felt weak. He dropped to his knees. He felt something flowed from him towards the man in front of him. He knew that if didn't release his hand, something bad was going to happen to him, but he wasn't able to do so. Keith was powerless as William slowly absorbed his soul.

"Captain of the guards, eh? Once we have you on our side, with Bud as mayor, this city is ours," William said.

Soon Keith was no more, just his empty body remained. William released his hand, flicked his fingers, and a new artificial soul emerged. He quickly threw it inside Keith's body. Once the soul was inside, Keith quickly stood up with a blank look on his face.

"Just a simple blank soul, I don't need more trouble. Daniel, you take care of the rest," Daniel suddenly laughed, which made William raised his eyebrows, "is something wrong?"

"Nothing, I just remembered that to get Bud and Mary out of prison, I made a deal to sleep with him"

"Really? Isn't he your vessel's brother?" William seemed amused.

"Half brother," Daniel corrected him, "it appeared Keith already fell in love with Claire since they were kids"

"Hoo... Interesting... What are you going to do with the deal?"

"I'll honor our deal, we owe him that much. But I don't think he will be around to enjoy it," Daniel chuckled.

Daniel spun around and saw that Bud already started to make out with Vina. Her dress was torn apart, exposing her breasts. Daniel could only shook his head on the view. William saw it too. However, his mind was on something else.

"What is it master?" Daniel realized something was wrong.

"There is a shift, I can sense it..." William seemed to look far beyond.

"You mean someone is using the shifting power?"

Instead of answering Daniel, William chanted an incantation and summoned his familiar. The cat like creature from before appeared out of thin air after a short black light flash. William didn't need to command anything at it, the will and purpose of the familiar was formed as William chanted the incantation earlier. Looking at its master for a second, it leapt towards the window. It passed through the glass like a ghost, then ran very fast towards the source of the shift.

"I wonder what my familiar will find there..." William said while grinning.

info.brief_description: A body swapping adventure in a fantasy world of magic, monsters and princesses.
info.description:
You're an ordinary citizen of the Mallow Kingdom, until something happens on one day that grants you the opportunity to experience life from alternative angles.

First Story: You leave the confines of the city to make a delivery to another city, and get attacked by bandits and your cart is over turned. You discover one of the things you were transporting is a magical mirror that swaps the bodies of those who look into it.

Second Story: As a student of magic, you find a tome in a magic shop with strange spells. To your dismay, reciting the spell inside kills you- but your soul from your body, allowing you to choose a new host. The only way to exit a body is to use the spell, and the victim's original soul is eradicated.

Third Story: After you defeat a band of goblins, a cursed bracelet sticks to your wrist that transforms you into anyone or thing that you kill, from this point forward. It cannot be removed and you cannot shift at will, except by killing.

Fourth Story: A warlock steals your soul. Someone defeats him and undoes his evil, but your soul is returned to the wrong body.

Feel Free to Add More Stories, just always leave an open branch. If you add a story idea, try and add at least one chapter to that branch to get the ball rolling.
